Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour payer des frais de labours, acheter  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, de riz des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Dembela et de Nina ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de NIENA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
SAFOURA  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Kankeletigui 4 group is made up of ten women, all married, from the village of Dembela, in the district of Niena, Sikasso region, in the third administrative district of the Republic of Mali. They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. On average, they are 35 years old with 4 children. 

 The women grow ground nuts, sugar peas, bambara peas, rice and millet. With the goal of increasing profitability, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program . The current loan will be used to pay labor costs, to buy enough ground nut seeds and rice, small equipment and intrants for cultivating, at the Dembela Grnad Market and the Niena town market. After the rainy season, crops are stored for a certain amount of time to increase in value before being sold and the Niena Grand Market and in the nearby markets, on a  retail (sometimes wholesale) basis, for cash to customers who are mostly from the large towns. 

Safoura plans to use her loan to buy one sack of urea, two sacks of complex cereal and the rest sill be used for labor and hoeing costs. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 - 40,000 CFA francs which will be used to pay interest  on the loan to to pay for the family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural intrants and labor costs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Planting bananas can be pursued as small-scale farming, as a source of food and feeds for the animals, and as additional income for the family. For the past two years, Teresita, a 45-year-old married mother of seven children in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, has been involved in banana production as a source of income. Earning approximately PHP 4,000.00 each month, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from GDMPC to buy planting materials and fertilizer for banana production.

Teresita, a new member of GDMPC, dreams of someday having a banana plantation with the help of God and GDMPC.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and fertilizer for banana production.

loans.name: Naom

texts.en:
Naom is a resident farmer in the Nyamira area of South Rift, Kenya. She is married with three children, ages 9, 5 and 1 year old. She has been farming for 10 years producing and selling maize, vegetables, bananas and tea for the local market. She gets additional income from her rental houses.

Naom has obtained a loan of 46,800 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will provide the family with milk and additional income. She says she wants to own three quality dairy cows in five years. Naom says farming inputs have become expensive and this is the main challenge for farmers in the area. However, she thanks Juhudi Kilimo for their services.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 26 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, vive en su propia casa al lado de su esposo Amancio 28 años y sus 02 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación para que en un futuro próximo sean hombres de gran provecho. Juana es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor a su familia. Ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde siembra cacao y café; viene realizando esta actividad desde hace 07 años. Y gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas, ella compró variedad de muebles para su hogar y a la vez compró su propia maquina fumigadora para el control de la plaga de insectos. En tiempo de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza, obligadamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Ella cuenta con espacios de tierra sin cultivar, lo cual inevitablemente necesita el apoyo de todos ustedes para llevar consigo su propósito, tiene proyectado sembrar sus fincas con más plantas de café. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante  sus sembríos y a sus adorados hijos. Este será su segundo crédito, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para concretar sus planes y por ende comprometerse a devolver  puntualmente los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más semillas de café para que pueda aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Juana is 26 years old, a native of Quimbiri city, and lives in her own house alongside her husband Amancio, who is 26, and 2 dear sons, for whom she wishes to provide a good education that will benefit them in the future.

Juana is a hard-working woman, who strives every day to provide the best for her family. She works in agriculture, sowing chocolate and coffee. She has been doing this for the last 7 years. And thanks to the fruits offered by her plants, she has bought a variety of furniture for her home and, at the same time, purchased her own fumigating machine to control plagues of insects.

At harvest time, and during weeding, she hires day laborers to advance more rapidly in her crop routine. She has land that is not as yet cultivated, and this requires the help of all of you to carry out her proposal, to sow more coffee plants on the vacant land.

For the good of the project, Juana hopes she can count on that same force and impetus which has characterized her past efforts to forge ahead with both her plantings and her adored children's welfare.

This will be her 2nd loan, and she hopes for the help of each of you to realize her plans, promising to make her payments punctually. With this loan, Juana will buy more coffee seeds so that she can increase production.

loans.use: buy coffee seeds to plant on her available land.

loans.name: Zainab A.

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Zainab.  She is married and has three children aged 5, 14 and 18 years. All of them are school-going children. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her brother's children. She takes cares of them like her own children. In 2007, Zainab established her ready-made ladies and gents wear business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant and able to provide a livelihood for her family. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000.  Zainab  has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan to buy jeans - 3 doz @ Le35,000, Snickers - 10 doz @ Le35,000, Office shirts - 10 doz @ Le37,000, Ladies Bags 8 - doz @ Le35,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000.  In the future, Zainab plans to import and open another business center so that she can employ more people and  give her children a quality education for them to be very good citizens. She treats the customers she serves in the entire Makeni town as special.  A reasonable amount of people visit her shop every day because she has good products. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more ladies and gents wear to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 36 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, sus hijos viven independientemente, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de San José que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Alejandro  es brindar el servicio de transporte público, ya que cuenta con su propia mototaxi, la cual lo trabaja mañana y tarde movilizando personas que viven en San José y también a los distintos caseríos de la zona, cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir sus gastos de su casa.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi y seguir brindando un buen servicio.  Alejandro es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el fin que en un futuro pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 36 years old and lives in his own home with his family. His children live independently. Alejandro receives all basic services. He resides in the District of San José, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. This area has businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Alejandro has a business providing public transportation services with his own motorcycle taxi. He works in the mornings and the afternoons, driving around people who live in San José. Alejandro also travels to different villages in the area. He has his own customer base and the income he earns is used to cover his household expenses.

Alejandro is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN in order to maintain his motorcycle taxi so that he can continue providing good service. He is a person who is well-known in the place where he lives because he is always concerned about the welfare of his family. His goal for the future is to provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a brother).

Sarah has a business of selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Sarah has requested for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes.  

The main business challenge(s) for Sarah include thieves during transportation of her goods and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell on wholesale only and also to build rental rooms.

Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Benkadi  C Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres que constituent le groupe BENKADI C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec Madame AFOU  assise au milieu.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et des semences pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village à LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 FCFA  en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
BENKADI C is a group made up of 10 married women with an average age of 32 and who have, on average, 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in a village called Maaro, which is located about 45 kms from the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
The group joined the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This will be their 5th loan cycle with the institution. Their previous loans have all been fully repaid.
Afou (sitting, in the middle of the picture) grows rice and groudnuts. She will use her part of the loan to buy the farm inputs and seeds she needs for her 0.5 hectare of farmland, and pay the labourers. The harvest will be sold in the village of Loutana and at the market of Sikasso. By the end of the season she should have made a profit of around 25 000 FCFA, with which she plans to pay back her loan and help her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She operates a mat weaving business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With her KES 15,000 loan, Fatuma wants to purchase blocks and cement to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase blocks and cement to renovate her house.

loans.name: Cenelia

texts.es:
A sus 59 años D. edad Cenelia es una luchadora incansable, dedicada a la venta D. comidas fritas, D. gaseosas, tinto y café, labor que desempeña diariamente D. 5:00 a.m. 8:00 p.m. pues en este horario hay buenas ventas y ha tenido la ventaja D. tener una buena ubicación en el sector.
Cenelia actualmente debe comprar insumos para la producción D. alimentos, como gaseosas, café, azúcar, maíz, harina, y papas, por lo que hoy solicita un préstamo, con el cual hacer esta inversión, mejorar las ventas, y proporcionalmente su calidad D. vida.
texts.en: At 59 years of age, Cenelia is a tireless and tenacious woman.  Her business is selling fried food, soda and coffee.  She carries out this work every day from 5.00am to 8.00pm as this is when she makes good sales.  She has the advantage of being in a good location in the neighborhood.  Cenelia currently needs to buy supplies for making her food.  She will buy soda, coffee, sugar, corn, flour and potatoes.  She is requesting a loan in order to make this investment, improve her sales and, proportionally, her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия занимается откормом скота на протяжении 10 лет. На воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Занятие бизнесом помогает ей в содержании семьи. Откорм скота приносит хорошие доходы. Зулфия просит займ для покупки крупного и мелкого рогатого скота для того чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получить максимальный прибыль. Она заранее благодарна всем вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Zulfiya feeds cattle for the last ten years. She is raising one child. This business helps her to support her family. Feeding of the cattle gives her good income. Zulfiya is asking for a loan to buy large and small horned cattle to expand her business and receive maximum profit. She is thankful in advance to everyone for help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Kambizi

texts.en:
Kambizi is a married woman, raising one young child. For the past two years, Kambizi has run a shop and hotel business, in addition to a side job as a farmer. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kambizi will use her loan of KES 60,000 to purchase essential business supplies such as cooking oil and groceries. Kambizi aspires to purchase a posho mill for grinding grain into flour and to open another business. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: To purchase essential business supplies such as cooking oil and groceries.

loans.name: Akylbek

texts.ru:
Акылбек 36-летний фермер, живущий в со своей семьей с двумя сыновьями семи и пяти лет в селе Ой- Тал (северо-восточная часть Кыргызстана). В поисках источника дохода, в 1996 года Акылбек начал свой бизнес в разведении скота, выращивании и перепродаже сельхоз продукции.  На участке Акылбека имеются яблони и грушевые деревья, а также особое внимание он уделяет культивированию и выращиванию особого сорта картофеля, пользующегося повышенным спросом у местного населения. Упорный и неустанный труд в бизнесе позволяет Акылбеку покрывать расходы своей семьи и хозяйства, а  также  планировать  будущее для своих детей.
Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Акылбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Акылбек намерен использовать для закупа кормов и сена на зиму, чтобы весной начать перепродажу скота.
texts.en: Akylbek is a 36 year-old farmer, living with his family and two sons, who are seven and five years old, in the the Oi-Tal village (north-eastern part of Kyrgyzstan).  In search of a source of income, Akylbek started his own business of breeding livestock, growing and reselling agricultural crops in 1996.  Akylbek has apple and pear trees on his plot of land and also devotes special attention to cultivating and growing a particular variety of potatoes that is in higher demand among the local residents.  His persistent and tireless labor in the business allows Akylbek to cover his family's and household expenses and also to plan his children's future.  In order to further increase his livestock quantity, Akylbek requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy additional livestock headcount for fattening up.  He plans to use the planned profit for the purchase of fodder and hay for the winter, so that he can start reselling livestock in the spring.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en: Jacklyne is a hardworking business woman aged 29. She is married and blessed with one child. She has been operating a business selling clothes for the past two years to support her family. She also runs a cereal shop to supplement her income. She has employed one person to help her in the business. Jacklyne has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to add to her stock of clothes for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth Maria

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth a sus 31 años de edad es madre de tres hijos de 9, 6 y 4 años. La señora Elizabeth se dedica al arreglo de uñas de las manos y los pies (manicure y pedicure) desde hace tres años con el fin de poder cuidar a su familia y percibir sus propios ingresos. La señora Elizabeth desea comprar herramientas de trabajo como esmaltes para uñas, accesorios, moldes, cortaúñas, limas y cremas corporales, lo anterior con el fin de tener las herramientas de trabajo para suplir la demanda de la temporada de fin de año y a la vez mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  A futuro la señora Elizabeth desea tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 31, has three children; ages 9, 6, and 4.  Elizabeth has been doing fingernails and toenails (manicures and pedicures) for three years.  She does this to be able to take care of her family and to get her own income.

Elizabeth wants to buy work materials like nail polish, accessories, molds, nail clippers, files and body creams.  She wants these items so that she has the work tools in order to meet the demand in the end of the year season.  She also wants to improve her family’s quality of life.

In the future Elizabeth wishes to have her own place.

loans.use: to buy work materials like nail polish, accessories, molds, nail clippers, files and body creams.

loans.name: Oisara

texts.ru: Ойсара занимается купле- продажей скота и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Её семья помогает ей в бизнесе. Они стараются улучшить жизненные условия и создать уют и удобства в своем доме. Ойсара хочет расширить свой бизнес и купить 3 голов крупного рогатого скота и посеять пшеницу и ячмень. С этой целью она просит о помощи, которая позволит ей продвигаться вперед.
texts.en: Oisara raises cattle for meat and also farms. She is married and a loving mother of four children. Her family helps her with her work. Oisara's family is working hard to improve their living conditions and to create a cozy and comfortable home. Oisara wants to expand her herd and plans to purchase three more calves as well as plant more wheat and oats. For this reason she has turned to KIVA for help as this will helps her to move her business forward.

loans.use: To buy cattle and seeds

loans.name: Mayra Johanna

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia tiene el nombre de Mirador ya que desde allí se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, agricultura y cría de animales, se caracterizan por ser amables y gentiles con todos sus visitantes.

La Señora. Mayra tiene 26 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo ha migrado al extranjero para con su trabajo mejorar la economía de su hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus familiares.
 
Doña Mayra se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, cuida de sus hijos y cómo pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa cría cuyes y pollos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en  alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Mayra is a member of the community bank "El Mirador" (The Overlook). She lives near the parish in Turi, named "Mirador" since from there you can see a large part of the city of Cuenca. The group works in commerce, agriculture, and raising animals. They are known for being nice and polite with all of their visitors. 

Mayra is 26 years old, married and has two children aged 10 and 7 who study in a small school in the city. Her husband has migrated to another country for work to help the economic situation of their home. She doesn't have her own house, and lives in the home of relatives. Mayra works doing household chores, taking care of her children and spends the majority of her time raising guinea pigs and chickens. 

The community bank is on their third loan cycle, which they will invest by purchasing chickens and chicken feed. Her goal is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy chicken and animal feed.

loans.name: Luz Fanny

texts.es: La señora Luz Fanny ha sido comerciante desde hace 20 años, con el fruto de sus actividades ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia ya que ha sido la jefe de su hogar desde hace muchos años cuando se separó del padre de sus 3 hijos. Desde hace dos años tiene un pequeño almacén en su casa en el cual vende ropa y calzado para toda la familia, para el cual necesita de compra de surtido para poder cumplir con varios encargos que tiene para varios de sus clientes y que no ha podido efectuar por falta de capital de trabajo. El sueño de la señora Luz Fanny es poder ampliar su almacén y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz Fanny has been a merchant for 20 years.  With the fruits of her labor she’s managed to raise her family since she’s been head of household for many years since she and her three children separated from her husband.

For the last two years she’s had a small store at home where she sells clothes and footwear for the entire family.  She needs to buy assorted stock for it to be able to fill pending orders she has for several of her customers and that she’s been unable to fulfill for lack of working capital.

Luz Fanny’s dream is to be able to expand her store and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothes.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children.
 
Vivian has a retail shop that sells sacks of vegetables like carrots and cabbages. She has had this business for 15 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Vivian is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jhony Aurelio

texts.es: El señor Jhony se dedica a la confección y  tejido de chompas y vestido de muñecas, el cliente ya trabajo en la institución en grupo comunales y demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad, actualmente el esta casado  pero  por cuestiones de trabajo su esposa se encuentra de viaje en el interior, ellos tiene dos hijos que son menores de edad que se encuentran en edad escolar, la inversión del crédito será en la compra de lana para el tejido y la compra de muñecas artesanales, las muñecas artesanales son parecidas a las mujeres del occidente de esta región, realiza un buen trabajo de calidad por esto tiene muchos pedidos en las tiendas artesanales,  El sr. jhony es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jhony works making and knitting sweaters and dresses for dolls.  He already worked with the institution, in communal banks, and showed punctuality and responsibility.  Currently he is married but for work reasons his wife is traveling in the interior.  They have two minor children who are of school age.

The investment of the loan will be to buy wool for the knitting and to buy traditional dolls, which resemble the women of the western part of this region.  He does good-quality work and so he has many orders from the handmade craft stores.

Jhony is an enterprising person who wants to improve himself and his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy wool and dolls.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is 35years old married woman and a mother of 3 children, two children attend the school. Basheeran is a house wife living with her spouse in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Basheeran husband’s works hard to support her family. He has an auto rickshaw for transportation services in the Multan, Pakistan. Now the condition of auto rickshaw is very bad due to lake of capital.
Basheeran is borrowing 25,000 PKR through BRAC Pakistan in order to repair auto rickshaw for her husband’s transportation services business.
Basheeran has been sustaining her husband’s business activities through her past one loan from BRAC Pakistan. 
Basheeran and her family will be thankful to the KIVA’s lender and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to repair auto rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
This business is a member of Queen Esther Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Jacinta is a married woman. She has no professional business training but she is very hard working in her day to day business life. She lives in Kiserian where she operates her business.

Jointly with her husband, Jacinta a business of sale of fruits at Kiserian opposite Ngong stage. The business is both retail and wholesale fruits that are sold are mostly bananas but other types can also be found there. Jacinta also operates a door to door business of selling used clothes which she buys from Gikomba Market in Nairobi. Her business outlet is Kiserian where most of her clients reside. Her products are mostly ladies wear; dresses, skirts and blouses. Jacinta has previously taken loans from the group are used to expand both of her businesses.

loans.use: With the USD 300 that she has requested, Jacinta will be in a position to further expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: START TOMATO FARMING

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a school drop-out and a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She has tried to start a business selling yam. However, she does not have enough capital to keep her in business. Therefore, she is seeking a loan of US$700 from Kiva .

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Armando Antonio

texts.pt:
Armando Felisberto C. is 39 years old. He was born in the city of Maputo. Armando was raised by his parents. His family’s financial situation allowed him to study until the 10th grade. Since 2006, Armando has been supporting his family through a small business in Massaca and #1030. In 2006 he was introduced to HLUVUKU—ADSEMA by his uncle and requested his first loan.

Today Armando’s business is doing well. It provides employment for Armando and one full time employee. With the income from the shop Armando supports his family and saves when possible.

With the loan of 30.000,00 MT, Armando plans to increase the volume of his stock in order to avoid the shortage of goods when demand is high. Armando’s work has a positive impact in his community because it provides employment for Armando and his wife. It also brings basic products closer to his clients especially the students and employees of the Gaiato Home in the neighborhood of Massaca I,.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO : Massaca 1 - Boane CLIENTE : Armando Antonio C. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Comercio VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 30.000,00 MT (1,200.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade. Inicio: 10/06/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Armando Felisberto C., de 39 anos de idade, natural de Cidade de Maputo, Provincia de Maputo,cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos seus Pais. A situação financeira da familia criou-lhe oportunidades para estudar ate a 10ª classe. Desde 2006 vem assumindo na intgra a gestao de negocio da familia e possui um estabelecimento Comercial em Massaca І. Em 2006 por por indicacao do seu Tio teve conhecmento da existencia da HLUVUKU—ADSEMA tendo aproximado e solicitado emprestimo para aplicacao do seu negocio. Desde entao a sua actividade conheceu outra dinamica tendo solicitado varios e outros emprestimo. Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo razoavel e providencia emprego a um trablhador e com o rendimento do negocio suporta encargos familiares e faz alguma poupanca.

Com o emprestimo de 30.000,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume de negocio de forma a evitar ruptura de stocks durante o tempo de maior procura. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego para ele proprio e a esposa, coloca o produto mas perto do cliente com particular destaque para todos residentes do bairro Massaca I, trabalhadores e alunos da casa Gaiato.

loans.use: To increase stock in his business

loans.name: Gloria Erlinda

texts.en:
Gloria Erlinda C. T., 26, buys and sells huipiles, the traditional Mayan women’s woven blouse. She can buy one from an individual weaver for about US$7 and sell it on market days for almost $10. She can sell about a dozen a month, making a profit approaching $36, a significant boost to her finances. She’ll use this loan to buy more huipiles for resale. (At the women’s meeting where Gloria was interviewed, it was not market day and she did not have any stock. However, the woman on the left is wearing one of Gloria’s huipiles. You see Gloria on the right.)

Gloria got her start four years ago by borrowing a little money from her brother, but now she uses the Friendship Bridge loans for working capital. What she’d love to do some day is have a big store or deposito with lots of items including drinks and the things everybody needs in daily life.

Gloria is still recovering from the devastation of Hurricane Stan, which hit the area at 8:30 am on October 5, 2005. Her house was destroyed by a landslide and she lost nearly everything she owned. Her husband’s family was killed. But life is going on, and they are in the process of rebuilding a house. Gloria has three kids aged 2, 5, and 7, and she does have the 7-year-old in school.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Gloria attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase huipiles for resale

loans.name: Hilda Blanca

texts.es:
Hilda is a 43 years old lady that has always worked with handcrafted goods. Recently, after becoming aware of an international demand, she teamed up with neighbors and started to raise guinea pigs. They wanted to take part in this new opportunity to generate additional income locally. She is very pleased with this activity for it has provided substantial profits to the families involved. Business has marched along satisfactorily and, although her husband's separation and the birth of her grandchild have not come under the best circumstances, she has been able to provide for her children and grandchild. It is unknown why the father has not been providing support. Forced by a spike in household expenses, she found this interesting way to generate income. She decided to increase her investment so her daughter may also take advantage of this activity. To do so she requests an amount of US$500.00, which will be used to purchase more guinea pigs and build more cages so that they can grow in quantity. Let's participate and enable Mrs. Hilda to prosper and fulfill her family's dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Hilda es una dama de 43 años de edad que siempre ha trabajado realizando artículos artesanales. Hace poco al enterarse de la gran oportunidad de negocio que había generado a nivel internacional la crianza de cuyes se asoció con sus vecinos para emprender este nueva oportunidad de generar ingresos adicionales dentro de su localidad.Esta actividad la tiene muy contenta porque en poco tiempo las familias que participan en esta labor han obtenido ganancias sustanciales.Las cosas han ido marchando bien y aunque la ausencia de su esposo y la llegada de su nieta al seno familiar no se han dado en las mejores circunstancias, ella ansía seguir velando por el bienestar de sus hijos y ahora también de su pequeña nieta que por diferentes motivos no recibe ningún apoyo de su progenitor. Debido a que los gastos en su hogar se han ido incrementado con el transcurrir de los días y que ha encontrado una interesante forma de generar ingresos ha decidido incrementar su capital de inversión a fin de que su hija pueda también beneficiarse con esta actividad. Por ello requiere una suma de 500 dólares con los que podrá comprar más cuyes y además acondicionar sus albergues a fin de que la cantidad se incremente rápidamente.Colaboremos para que Hilda siga albergando los sueños de su numerosa familia.

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs and cage installation.

loans.name: Mohammad Azim

texts.en: Mohammad Azim lives in District 7 of Kabul Afghanistan and is married and since he is the only son, he has the responsibility of helping his family which he is happy to do. He is a tailor who has a lot of experience in his work so he wants to expand his business by taking out an individual loan. With this loan he hopes to buy new machines and increase his stock which will help him make a good income. He also wants to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new machines and expand his stock

loans.name: Martina Felicita

texts.es:
Martina Felicita is 55 years old. She studied through secondary school. She has 6 children; only one remains dependent on her. She lives in the district of El Porvenir in Trujillo province in the department (region) of La Libertad in Peru. She started her business selling prepared foods in the wholesale market of the city of Trujillo. She worked 35 years in that business but the constant change of temperature between cooking and washing gave her a very delicate illness and forced her to change direction.

Currently she has a stand in the shopping center El Virrey in which she sells cosmetics, colognes, shampoos, and creams of different brands. She buys her products from a catalog, and every time she has the chance she travels to the city of Lima to buy men's clothing wholesale along with some cosmetic products.

Martina is a member of the community bank Victor Raul. When she received her first loan of 300 soles /Peruvian currency) she was still working selling food; she bought soft rinks, beer, rice and milk with the loan. With his new loan of 2200 soles, which she will repay in full in 4 months, she will travel to Lima to buy summer clothing and dress clothing. She plans to sell the clothing during the end-of-year holidays. Martina dreams of opening a toy store in another rented stand in the same shopping center.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran.

La señora Martina Felicita tiene 55 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene 6 hijos pero solo 1 depende de ella. Vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Inició su negocio vendiendo comida en un mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Trujillo, trabajó 35 años en este negocio pero el cambio de temperatura constante al cocinar y lavar a la vez hizo que adquiriera una enfermedad muy delicada por lo que tuvo que cambiar de giro.

Actualmente tiene un stand en el centro comercial “El Virrey” en el que vende cosméticos, colonias, shampoo y cremas de diferentes marcas, estos productos los compra por catálogo; además cada vez que tienen oportunidad viaja a la ciudad de Lima a comprar ropa de hombre al por mayor y también algo de cosméticos.

La señora Martina es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl”, cuando recibió su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 todavía se dedicaba a la venta de comida por lo que compró gaseosa, cerveza, arroz y aceite. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, viajará a Lima para traer ropa de verano y ropa de fiesta que piensa vender en estas fiestas de fin de año. La señora Martina sueña con poner una juguería en otro stand que alquila en el mismo centro comercial.

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Tolani

texts.en:
Tolami O. is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. She comes from Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells cooked food to people living in her community and has been in business since 1999. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more foodstuff for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria U. is married with 2 children, and is 37 years old. She hails from Ajangbadi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells rechargeable cards and also makes calls for people. She has been in business since 2003 and needs a loan of $875 to enable her to buy more rechargeable cards in bulk for sales.

loans.use: To buy more rechargeable cards to sell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa, 55, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She finished one year of high school. She has five grown children, none of whom still live with her. Mornings, she sell green vegetables, potatoes, onions, etc. in a local market. She buys wholesale supplies of the produce in the La Hermelinda market. She used to work as a street vendor in the market many years ago and knows it well. She also makes money raising animals, sheep and pigs, that can be butchered when they reach the right size and sold to her neighbors and friends who anxiously wait to place their orders with her.

Maria Luisa belongs to the San Borja community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. She used the first loan to buy a variety of green vegetables. With this loan of S/.700, to be repaid in four months, she will buy potatoes, onions, pickles and other produce. Her greatest wish is to buy a house closer to the city because where she lives now is very far away.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Luisa García D. O. tiene 55 años D. edad, vive en el Sector América en el distrito D. Moche provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad. Estudio solo hasta el primer año D. secundaria. Tiene cinco hijos que ya no dependen D. ella. Ella venD. todo tipo D. verduras, papa, cebolla, etc. todas las mañanas en el mercado D. Moche. Compra su mercadería al por mayor en el mercado “La Hermelinda” en el distrito D. Trujillo. Hace muchos años venD. en condición D. ambulante en este mercado y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien. Se dedica también a la crianza D. animales como: carneros y chanchos el cual sacrifica cuando han adquirido el tamaño ideal, la carne lo distribuye a sus vecinos y amigos que le hacen pedidos anticipadamente.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “San Borja” lugar donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con el cual compro una variedad D. verduras. Con el préstamo D. S/. 700.00 que lo cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 2 arrobas D. papa, 1 costal D. cebolla, escabeche y otras verduras. Su mayor sueño es comprar una casa en el centro del distrito D. Moche porque el lugar donD. actualmente vive esta muy alejado D. la ciudad.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Thị Ngọc
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cenelia Maria

texts.es:
Cenelia María is seeking her third loan, with which she hopes to build a bedroom. For the past five years, this young woman has worked in the Ministry of Education in the colony of La Fonseca, at the Rafaela Herrera School. Currently, she is in her second year of studies at the URACCAN University. She has a two year old baby. Each day, Cenelia has to travel for two hours on foot because she teaches classes to children in another region. She is asking for a loan to be able to build another room in her house and that way improve the living conditions of her family. Despite the fact that she is a single mother, she is very responsible and enterprising and struggles so that her daughter does not go without. Her dreams are to have work stability, a dignified home and, most of all, good health.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Cenelia María está solicitando su tercer refinanciamiento, con el cual pretende construir una habitación, esta joven trabaja para el Ministerio de Educación en la colonia la Fonseca en la Escuela Rafaela Herrera desde hace 5 años, actualmente esta estudiando 2do año en la Universidad URACCAN, tiene una bebita de 2 años, Cenelia todos los días tiene que viajar a 2 horas de camino a pie ya que da clase a niños de una comarca. Está solicitando este prestamo para así construir una habitación y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, a pesar que es una madre soltera es muy responsable y emprendedora que lucha para que a su hija no le falte nada, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda digna y salud sobre todo.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Solihahon

texts.ru:
Solihahon started in business nearly 10 years ago. She's 36 now and is a single mother with a child. She started out selling various small things and then decided to buy and sell men's clothes.

A year and a half ago, Solihahon applied to MicroInvest and got her first loan to update her autumn collection of clothes. Since then, she has considerably increased her capital. One of the major events in her life was that with her business profits and personal savings she was able to purchase a Daewoo-Tico car. The car has been helping her with business.

At this time, the season for selling summer clothes has begun,and Solihahon has applied to MicroInvest for a new loan.

Translated from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Солихахон начала заниматься бизнесом около 10 лет назад. Ей 36 лет, она незамужем и воспитывает 1 ребенка. Начинала с продажи разной мелочевки, затем решила перейти на куплю-продажу мужской одежды.

Солихахон 1.5 года назад обратилась в Микроинвест и получила свой первый займ на обновление ассортимента осенней одежды. С тех пор она значительно увеличила свой оборотный капитал. Одним из знаменательных событий в ее жизни стало то, что она на полученную прибыль и сэкономленные собственные сбережения сумела приобрести автомобиль Daewoo-Tico. Этот маленький автомобиль стал хорошим подспорьем в ее бизнесе.

Сейчас начинается сезон продаж летней одежды и Солихахон обратилась в МикроИнвест за новым займом.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 56-year-old Zuhura M., who is married and has four children aged between 19 and 36. She has two dependents living with her because they are orphans. In 2007, Zuhura established her traditional African cloth business. Working 7 days a week, and 11 hours a day, she earns about $200 every month from this business. Zuhura has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth in bulk. In the future, she plans to renovate her place of business. Zuhura thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women..

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Juan Conrado

texts.es:
Juan started the business because he had a many friends to whom he could offer meals and because he has the ability to prepare them with the help of his wife. He wanted to offer wellbeing to his family and, because he didn’t have a job and a steady salary, he had to look for another way to earn an income to be able to pay for household necessities and because his oldest son was about to start elementary school and so those expenses were going to increase. He started in April of 2005 when he began to to sell meals on his own because before he helped his mother-in-law with her business preparing and delivering meals. But then he became independent and thanks to that now works full time in this business. It has gone very well for him and now has a large number of clients.

Juan needs a loan for US$500, which he plans to repay in five months, to buy products and utensils to be used in the preparation of meals that will allow him to handle his clients orders.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan inició el negocio porque tenía muchas amistades entre las cuales podía ofrecer comidas y porqué tiene la facilidad de prepararlas con la ayuda de su esposa. El quería ofrecerle bienestar a su familia y como no tenía un empleo y un sueldo seguro tenía que buscar la forma de obtener un ingreso para poder cubrir las necesidades de su hogar ya que su hijo mas grande iba a entrar y a estudiar la primaria y los gastos se iban a incrementar. Comenzó en Abril de 2005 cuando empezo a vender comidas por su cuenta, ya que antes le ayudaba a su suegra en su negocio preparando comidas y entregándolas a domicilio, pero entonces se independizó y gracias a ella ahora se dedico a esta actividad en la cual le ha ido muy bien y en la actualidad cuenta con un buen número de clientes.

El necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar materia prima y utensilios para la elaboración de comidas que le permitan atender los pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase products and utensils used to prepare meals

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida baji A. D. is married with five children, and lives in the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeat and decorative embroidery. She has been living in this city for the last 11 years. None of her children go to school. Her husband is a buffalo milk vendor and has been in this profession for the last 20 years. He currently has two buffalos at his house. Zubaida baji prefers to do house work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan of $525 to buy another buffalo to expand her husband's dairy business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to expand her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr:
Madame L. Koko est une dame âgée de 50 ans et résidant à Aného dans le quartier LEGBANOU. Mariée elle a deux personne pratiquement à sa charge, car son mari vieillissant n’a plus de force nécessaire pour mener à bien son métier d’agriculteur.

Courageuse et entreprenante, elle tire ses revenus du commerce de pagnes qui  constitue son activité principale.

Elle désire aujourd’hui renforcer son commerce. Ainsi, elle sollicite un crédit  pour l’achat de pagnes et bijoux. Cela lui permettra de rehausser son revenu et de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Koko L. is a 50 year-old lady, resident of Aného in the LEGBANOU district. A married woman, with an aging husband who no longer has the strength necessary to continue his work as a farmer, she has two persons to take care of. Courageous and entrepreneurial, her main income and primary business comes from the sale of cloths. Today, she would like to strengthen her small business and is thus requesting a credit to purchase cloths and jewellery. This will help increase her income and contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of cloths and jewellery

loans.name: Salimatou

texts.fr: Salimatou N., 20 ans, mariée, 02 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter des arachides qu’elle décortique et transforme en pâte d’arachide pour vendre. Elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un  prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Salimatou N. is 20 years old, married, has 2 children in her care, and has been a member of the village loan group of Sinthiang Coundara for 5 and a half years. Her business consists of buying peanuts, which she shells and transforms into peanut paste for sale. She would like to strengthen her business. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts, wood, buckets, and to pay for labour

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Meach A. is 37 years old. She is rice farmer who also raises pigs for sale. She is married and started the business with her husband in 1979. She has three children, all of whom live in the family home. One daughter is a garment worker and two help farm rice.

To sell her pigs for slaughter on time for a high price, Meach A. needs a loan to purchase pig food to fatten her existing pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pig food to fatten her existing pigs.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: El señor Rolando Verón es un joven de 20 años, es muy trabajador, trabaja desde los 15 años vendiendo cosas de primera necesidad para sus vecinos y luego amplio el negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Por eso necesita del crédito de la Fundación paraguaya para seguir creciendo y en un futuro tener su propio local, para estabilizarse. De este negocio depende la familia de el ya que su padre falleció y es el sustento de su madre y hermanos, el también va a la Universidad, pues es un joven visionario y sabe que el estudio es importante para el crecimiento de una persona en todos los ámbitos, esto lo ayudara a progresar mas en la vida, ya que tiene las ganas, solo falta el capital económico.
texts.en:
Mr. Rolando Verón is 20 years old, he is very hardworking and has worked since he was 15 selling essential goods to his neighbors and expanding his business with great effort. He needs credit from the Fundación Paraguaya to continue growing and to have his own store in the future to be stable. His family depends on this business because his father passed away and he supports his mother and brothers. He also goes to the university because he is a visionary young man and knows that studying is important to grow as a person in all areas; this will help him progress further in life because he has the desire, he only lacks the capital.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying blenders, irons, coffee makers, color TV, blender, hair dryer, toaster etc

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde O. is 44-years-old and is married with six children. She sells goats, and with her increasing customer base, she is requesting a loan of $675 (N100,000) to purchase more goats and increase her sales. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO.

loans.use: To purchase more  goats to sell

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: S. is 30 years old a resident of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia, where she runs a stall raising pigs. For additional income, she also grows rice crops, which she can plant twice per year, once during the rainy season and once during the dry season. S. is married and has no child. Her husband’s name is Troeung, is aged 31, and he works sawing wood and harvesting rice for income. S. is seeking a loan to buy water buffalo to be used to plow a farmland and the future for offspring.

loans.use: To buy water buffalo for plowing her field.

loans.name: Christiane

texts.fr:
Originaire de GLO, un petie village du département de l'Atlantique situé à près de 100 Km de la ville de Cotonou la capitale économique du BENIN. A. Christiane est âgée de 45 ans. Veuve depuis 8 ans, A. Christiane est mère de cinq enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles. Seuls les trois derniers enfants sont scolarisés. Il s'agit de Damien âgé de 11 ans en classe de CM1, de Gisèle âgée de 9 ans en classe de CE2 et le benjamin âgé de 8 ans et en classe de CE1. En plus de ses enfants A. Christiane a, à sa charge une de ses sœurs qui l'aide dans la vente du maïs.A. Christiane dépense en moyenne 1000 F pour les dépenses alimentaires de sa famille. La famille vit à GANKPODO un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou depuis 25 ans où A. Christiane exerce l'activité de la vente du pain de façon ambulante et du maïs en détail chez elle à la maison. A. Christiane envisage diversifier son activité par la vente des divers (cartons de sucre, de biscuits, de lait concentré et en poudre, des détergents, des bombons, de la farine de manioc, etc.) A. Christiane veut aussi renforcer la vente du maïs en s'approvisionnant en grande quantité  de maîs. Car par moment A. Christiane se retrouve en rupture de stock alors que la demande existe. C'est pour ces différentes raisons que A. Christiane sollicite son premier crédit. 


p> 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Having roots in GLO, a small village in Atlantique County (located 10 km from the city of Porto-Novo, the political capital of BENIN), Ms. A. Christiane, age 45, has been a widow for eight years and is the mother of five children (two boys and three girls). Only the last three are in school: Damien, age 11, in the 4th grade; Gisèle, age 9, in the 3rd grade; and the youngest son, age 8, is in the 2nd grade. In addition to her children, she supports one of her sisters who helps with selling corn.

A. Christiane spends 1,000 francs on average for food for her family. She and her family have been living in GANKPODO, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou, for 25 years. There, she works selling bread door-to-door and corn at the retail level out of her home.

She envisions diversifying her business by selling various goods (boxes of sugar, cookies, evaporated and powdered milk, detergents, candy, cassava flour, etc.) She also wants to boost her sales of corn, since she is out of stock at the moment, while the demand is still there. For these different reasons, she’s requesting her first loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for receipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two 100-kg sacks of corn and various goods for resale

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita C., 29 years old, is the mother of three children and a helpful wife to her husband. Leonita and her family resides at Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Leonita helps her husband in their lumber/timber business. They need additional capital amounting to PHP 10,000 to sustain the demand and for Leonita and her husband to be able to grow their business.

loans.use: To finance their timber/lumber business

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Mrs. Jinky G. is a resident of Barangay Tamban, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with one child. She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC since 2007. According to her, she is lucky to be one of the many patrons of the cooperative.
 
PMPC has helped her a lot in her project, which is house repairs. She has received a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase housing materials and pay for labor. Being a co-op member, she knew that it gives her a lot of benefits. Jinky and her husband strive to make a living to be able to pay back the loan on time.
 
Now she wishes that through Paglaum MPC, their lives will change for the better.

loans.use: Purchase materials for house repairs and pay labor expenses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 44 years old and she has 4 children. She sells sarongs and laces and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She is, indeed, grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es: Nubia del Carmen  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su cuarto crédito para Construcción de una habitacion, trabaja como docente desde hace 5 años en la Escuela Francisco Aaron Joce ,  tiene un hijo de 6 añitos de edad estudiando 1er grado en la escuela donde ella labora, Nubia es una mujer muy  responsable, honesta, trabajadora, vive en colonia Naciones a 28 km de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas; la profesora Nubia vive con su mama la cual se encarga del cuido de ella ysiempre esta pendiente de comprarle sus alimentos y  medicamentos de su anciana madre y  actualmente  esta estudiando una licenciatura en ciencias sociales  en la Univesidad  URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea,    su sueño es   seguir  estudiando, salud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita   y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Nubia del Carmen is requesting refinancing of her fourth loan to build a room. She has been working as a teacher for 5 years at the school Francisco Aaron Joce. She has a 6 year-old son who is in 1st grade in the school where she is working. Nubia is very responsible, honest, and hard-working. She lives in the neighborhood of Naciones, 28 km from Nueva Guinea, where population is in constant growth. Mrs. Nubia lives with her mother, and is responsible for her well-being, always paying attention to buying her ancient mother's food and medicines. At the present she is studying a bachelor's degree in social science at the University URACCAN in Nueva Guinea. It is her dream to continue studying, have health, and in the future a nice house as well as work stability to be able to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Mrs. Phally Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people, living in Chrouy Ampil village in Kandal province, comprise this village bank loan. They will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phally K. is a 40-year-old village bank president. She is a widow and owns a business as kramar-maker (traditional shawls). In her business, she wants to make more kramars to support her customers. Thus, Mrs. Phally K. decided to request a loan to purchase more silks to support her business. She hopes to increase income and improve her family’s living standards. Mr. Tat YU. does not come to take the loan, his wife does, so she is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To purchase more silk to support her business.

loans.name: Vaovai

texts.en: Vaovai F. L., 63, is married with 9 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~ USD).  SPBD loans are Vaovai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knapsack sprayer, knives, chemicals, seeds, spade, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and poultry food

loans.name: Micaela Villegas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL
MICAELA VILLEGAS

La alcancía Comunal Micaela Villegas es un grupo muy unido conformado por 10 integrantes las cuales son personas puntuales, solidarias y positivas.
 
La presidenta María es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, ella se dedica al negocio de la Lonchera Escolar desde hace un año, y durante las vacaciones vende chompas y así puede ayudar en casa.

Eduardo es el Secretario del grupo, es  una persona muy hábil que se dedica a la venta de cerveza que es un negocio heredado de sus padres. Tiene como objetivo hacer de su negocio una distribuidora al por mayor.

Mary P. es la tesorera del grupo y tiene su negocio de fotostática, el crédito será destinado al mejoramiento de las máquinas fotocopiadoras.

Los demás socios tienen diferentes negocios como venta de prendas de vestir, crianza y venta de mascotas, productos de belleza, servicio de confecciones, etc. que gracias a los créditos pueden generar ingresos  ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Micaela Villegas Communal Bank is a closely-knit group made up of 10 members who are punctual, supportive and positive. María, the group president, is a single mother of 5 children. She has been operating a school lunch counter for one year. During the holidays, she sells sweaters to help with the home expenses. Eduardo is the group secretary. He is a skillful person who sells beer at a business that he inherited from his parents. Eduardo hopes to become a wholesale distributor. Mary P. is the group treasurer and operates a photocopying business. She will use her loan to upgrade her copying machines. Other members have different businesses such as selling clothing, breeding and selling pets, cosmetics sales, tailoring, etc. Thanks to the loans, they can generate income on which their families depend.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products & supplies

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia  is 54 years old and married with 5 children. She sells sarongs and other second hand clothes. She has been in this business for long.  She hopes for the loan amount of N70000 to purchase more second hand clothes and sarongs. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and clothes to sell

loans.name: Afivi

texts.fr: Afivi est une dame qui a appris la couture mais qui s’est spécialisée dans les surfilages et les plinthes. La situation géographique de son atelier de couture est localisée dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2000 et elle est très connue de beaucoup de personnes. Aussi, profite-t-elle pour vendre certains articles de mercerie comme les popelines, les vicelines, les rubans, des fils à coudre. Elle a besoin actuellement de renouveler quelques articles manquants ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle voudrait un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des fils de surfilage et des fils de plinthe. Cette femme est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.

loans.use: Achat des fils de surfilage et des fils de plinthe

loans.name: Jovel

texts.en: Jovel B. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 23 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Jovel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jovel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand his product offering

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife B., 35 years old is a rice grower from Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur. She has three children who are students. Her eldest child is 14 years old. She has been doing the best she can to help her husband earn an income to buy the family's needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 9,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farm necessities. With her loan, she will be able to sustain her livelihood and have adequate food for her family.

loans.use: To buy farm necessities

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
This is Loreta U., a 57-year-old widow living with her five adult children in a poor community in Parola, Binondo, Manila. Loreta has been working with her old sewing machine for more than ten years now, making and marketing infant wear and infant accessories like comforters and fluffy pillows. She makes 45,000 Philippine pesos a month. She has already bought a motorcycle out of her profits.

Loreta is among the pioneer members of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She joined in 1998. Loans provided by the cooperative were very helpful in maintaining her business. She is now applying for a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos as fresh capital for her business. She will buy raw materials like fabric, cotton, thread and other accessories. She has been dreaming of her own house and lot.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, cotton, thread and other sewing needs

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 38, is married to Mary Njoki and they have three school-age children.  He has been selling clothes in Niavasha town for the last three years.

He heard about KADET through one of KADET's promotional events around his business area.  This will be his second loan and he plans to use it to add to his inventory of clothing to sell to customers.  He paid the first loan well and on schedule.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his business by moving into a bigger clothing shop. 

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Amelia S. de 59 años de edad, reside en Soyapango en el departamento de 
San Salvador, vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y un nieto. Ella posee una tienda la cual tiene como nombre “tienda Conchi”, negocio el cual ha contribuido durante 26 años a los gastos del hogar y le ha permitido a Rosa y su esposo brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos. Rosa solícito un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su negocio comprando productos de primera necesidad, los cuales tienen mucha demanda en el lugar. Todo esto permitirá que Rosa siga adelante con su tienda y pueda tener la dicha de verlo mucho más surtido de productos y de esta manera percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia Sanchez is 59 years old and resides in Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. She lives together with her husband, two children, and a grandchild. She owns a store named "Tienda Conchi", which for 26 years has contributed to paying her home expenses and has enabled Rosa and her husband to provide the best for their children. Rosa is requesting a loan in order to be able to invest more in her business, purchasing essential products that are in high demand in her region. All of this will allow Rosa to continue moving forward with her store and to have the good fortune of seeing it better stocked with products, and therefore receive greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase essential products for her store

loans.name: Joseph Murigi

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old and married to Judy. They have two daughters and one son. Joseph was introduced to Kadet by a Kadet credit officer through marketing outreach. He has been operating a water distribution business for one year and also sells livestock occasionally. With this loan, Joseph plans to purchase two more donkeys, which he intends to lend to other people for water transport. 

He intends to purchase a donkey-cart and employ casual workers to fetch and distribute water to the local people in the community. He also wants to grow his business with the extra profits generated from the business. His hopes are to purchase a piece of land and build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase donkeys for transporting water

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr: M. Rachelle est née le 18 Janvier 1962 et vit depuis environs 7 ans à PK10 Marina, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à ODOULAMI Daniel, un chauffeur, Rachelle est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à PK10 Marina. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Rachelle a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis environs 10 ans, Rachelle vend des tissus, de la friperie et quelquefois des bijoux de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Rachelle s’approvisionne. Rachelle a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Rachelle sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer davantage son activité et de répondre efficacement à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
M. Rachelle was born on January 18, 1962. She has lived in PK10 Marina, in the Sèmè-Podji Commune, in Bénin, for around 7 years. She is married to Odoulami Daniel, a driver, and is the mother of three children who are all educated. They all live together in PK10 Marina, and she and her husband cover the family’s expenses together. Rachelle did not complete secondary school.
For almost 10 years, Rachelle has worked as a street vendor selling cloth, second hand clothing and sometimes jewellery. Rachelle stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Bénin.
Rachelle has already received and repaid two loans through Alidé. She is requesting a third Alidé loan to expand her business and meet customer demands.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 25 lengths of cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael is a 25-year-old woman, whose husband works for Akamba Bus Company. She has two children, one of whom is in school. She has been running her business, Bop C Shop, where she sells sugar, fat, rice, soap, tea leaves and other items, since 2004. With the Kes. 75,000 loan, she wants to increase stock for her shop. Her other source of income is a green-grocery.  She hopes to improve her business to help boost her family's standard of living. She wants to grow her business to the wholesale level in the future. Rael describes herself as hard-working and promising.

loans.use: To increase stock in sugar, fat, rice, soap, tea leaves and cereals

loans.name: Aca Obede

texts.pt:
Aça Obede Dauana nasceu no Distrito de Boane,  Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 35 anos de idade, casada mae de 3 filhos de 09,04 e 01 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Tem a 10 classe feita e ainda continua a estudar, neste momento frequenta o 2º ano de formação de professores. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a mae que vive na localidade de Mahubo enviando dinheiro para as despesas de casa.
Nunca saiu de Boane, nasceu na localidade de Mahubo, mais tarde construiu uma residencia com a sua familia em Boane no bairo Fichi onde continua a residir actualmente. Ė funcionaria do Ministerio da Educação a mais de 9 anos, foi formada pelo Centro de Formação de professores de Namaacha e trabalha das 11.00h as 17.55h auferindo  um salario de 4.500.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que tambem sao clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, pedra e outros ) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residencia. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt,15.000.00mt e 30.000.00mt todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar com a construção da casa e apostar cada vez mais no negocio que esta iniciando.
texts.en:
Aça Obede Dauana was born in the district of Boane, in Maputo province, southern Mozambique. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of three children 9, 4 and 1 year old. The oldest attends school. She completed 10th grade and is still studying- she is currently in the second year of teacher training. She lives with her family in her own home, and supports her mother who lives in the village of Mahubo sending her money for household expenses. She has never left Boane district, and was born in Mahubo. Later, she built a home with her family in the Fichi neighborhood of Boane where she continues to live. She has been an employee of the Ministry of Education for over nine years, and was trained at the Teacher Training Center in Namaacha. She works from 11 am until 5:55 pm and earns a monthly salary of 4500 MZN, which she uses for household expenses as well as saving some in her bank account. She has never taken out loans with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the organization. This is her fourth loan, for 10,000 MZN, which she plans to use to buy construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, stone and others) to continue building her residence. The previous loans were for 10,000, 15,000 and 30,000 MZN, all for the same purpose. In the future she would like to take out additional loans to complete construction of her house and invest more in the business that she is starting.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sand and others)

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita, 54 years old, has been farming for a decade. This is what she and her husband do for a living. She works hard for her family, especially her children: she wants all of them to finish college and have a bright future.

Angelita is grateful to have gained access to CEVI’s program. She said she likes it because of the low interest rate, which will really help her earn from her farm. She requested Php 6,000, which will be used to purchase farm supplies such as seed, fertilizer and other items.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. is from the village of Nattapian West, Solana, Cagayan. She is 26 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader for a 19-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business that provides recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from collecting junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years, and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional waste and junk materials to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to make improvements to her house.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional waste and junk material to resell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
