Yaa A. is married and cooks rice to sell at Jukwa. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a driver.

Yaa has been selling rice for some time now. She supports her husband in paying for their accommodation and water bill. Her loan will be used to buy bags of raw rice and other ingredients to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients to cook

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont mariés majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et habitent  toutes  à Farabougou, village de la Commune Rurale de Téssérèla  (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et mariage.
Ce groupe  qui est à son premier prêt solidaire, fait le commerce d’articles divers avec les condiments alimentaires, le poisson séché, le gombo, les feuilles de fakoye, des céréales, su Sounbala, etc. 
 Madame Nièdiogou  Sangaré qui  est un des membres du groupe Benkadi, est  bien connue dans la zone grâce à sa spécialisation de séchage du poisson frais.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter, 50 kg de poisson frais au bord du fleuve Bani avec les pêcheurs. Le poisson est d’abord séché dans un coin de la cours avec un séchoir conçu traditionnellement pour la circonstance pendant au moins une semaine. Nièdiogou à l’instar des autres membres du groupe revend sa marchandise à domicile, dans les foires de Gassola, Tissala et Téssérèla au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour, rembourser le prêt et contribuer à  certaines dépenses familiales. 
Elles ont pour ambition l’achat d’une charrette et d’un âne pour assurer leur transport et celui des marchandises dans les différentes foires.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi are generally married in large, traditional extended families. They are on average 37 years old with five children, all living in Farabougou, a village in the Rural Community of Téssérèla (4th administrative region of Mali). They are acquainted through family ties and through marriage. The group, which is on its first group loan, does business selling various products such as condiments, dried fish, okra, fakoye (wild leaf used as seasoning), grains, sounbala (condiment made from seeds of the néré tree), etc. Mrs. Nièdiogou Sangaré, one of the members of the Benkadi group, is well-known in the area, thanks to her specialization in dried fish. She plans to use her loan to buy fifty kilograms of fresh fish from those who fish on the banks of the Bani River. The fish is first dried in a corner of the courtyard for a week on a drying rack designed traditionally for the purpose. Nièdiogou, like other members of the group, resells her products from home and in the markets of Gassola, Tissala, and Téssérèla, for cash and on credit to both men and women. They hope to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to reimburse the loan and contribute to certain family expenses. Their ambition is to buy a cart and a donkey to transport them and their wares to various markets.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Señor Víctor C. P. tiene 29 años y esta concubina con la Señora Eleuteria Veizaga Fuentes por más de 6 años, tiene tres hijos menores, el esposo es agricultor produce papa, papalisa en su terreno que tiene 2 hectáreas en la comunidad de Chullpani, la esposa ayuda en la actividad agrícola, en cuidado de ganados vacunos, cuidado de los hijos y de la casa. 

Don  Víctor y su familia viven en una comunidad Chullpani a 18 km de colomi muy alejado de la ciudad por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero. El CIDRE tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural, y se descubre que el Don Víctor necesitaba capital para ampliar y aumentar la producción de papa, papalisa,ya que él tiene terrenos que no están cultivados. 

Don Víctor nos comenta quiere ampliar la producción de papa, papalisa así tener ingresos suficiente para ahorrar dinero en CIDRE mismo para que sus hijos estudien en una escuela de la ciudad, el sueña de Victor es ver a sus hijos profesionales agrónomos para que ayuden con la asistencia técnica en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Sr. Víctor C. P. is 29 years old and has been in a common law relationship with Sra. Eleuteria Veizaga Fuentes for more than six years. They have three young children. Don Victor is a farmer who grows potatoes and ulluco on two hectares of land that he owns in the community of Chullpani. His wife helps with the farming activities, taking care of the cattle, looking after the children, and taking charge of the household duties.

Don Victor and his family live in the community of Chullpani, which is 18km away from the city. Therefore, it is difficult for him to get to a bank to request a loan. CIDRE took the initiative to come to this rural area. As a result, Don Victor was able to acquire the necessary capital to expand and increase his potato and ulluco production since he has land that has not yet been cultivated.

Don Victor says he wants to expand his production of potatoes and ulluco so that he can earn sufficient income to open a savings account with CIDRE and pay for his children to attend school in the city. His dream is for them to become professional agronomists so that they will gain the technical knowledge that can be used for farming.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy potato seedings to increase production

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang S., age 52 years, is a widow with nine children: one son and eight daughters. Six of them are married and live outside the family home, two assist their mother in the business and another one attends school. They are living along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Samnang has just been selling soup, Chinese noodles, coffee and porridge in her village for six months. She hopes to expand the shelter where she operates the business, so Samnang is asking for her first of $1,000 to use for the purpose. She will also use a part of her loan to purchase soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: To expand the shelter where she sells soup, Chinese noodles, coffee and porridge and buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Habibulo

texts.en:
G. Habibulo is from the district of Dj.Rasulov, Tajikistan. Currently, he dedicates himself to his livestock business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. He is the father of 4 children who he cares for and has the responsibility of educating. It’s important to note that Habibulo is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. For this reason, he turned to IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase some pregnant cows to help him increase his income. With your help, Habibulo will be able to make his business succeed and support his family. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Amematusia

texts.en: Madame Amematusia S. is 28 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. She has a small store in the Avedji neighborhood of Lome where she sells all sorts of different products, including drinks, cereals, phone cards, and other grocery items. She is married to a man in the military and they have two children. Madame S. has had her store since 2005 and is requesting her first loan from WAGES of 200,000 CFA. She'll use the loan to purchase four sacks of corn, 30 bags of Pure Water to sell, and phone cards.

loans.use: To purchase corn, water, phone cards, and other items

loans.name: Georffery

texts.en: Georffery is 35 years old and married with three children, aged 12, 11 and 10 months. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years, but was previously employed in a supermarket. He was able to save part of his salary and managed to open his retail shop.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management skills and this has helped him improve his business. Georffery has requested a loan of 30,000 KES, which he will use to purchase stock, including sugar, maize flour and soap.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Ivan Dario

texts.es:
DesD. las 7:00  D. L. mañana hasta horas muy tarD. en L. noche, en un lugar ubicado en plena avenida murillo, cercano a importantes centros comerciales D. L. ciudad D. BarranquilL. y bajo un calor refrescado por los vientos alisios que soplan  L. ciudad en sus distintas épocas, usted pasa y encuentra siempre D. domingo a domingo a Iván Darío, sentado en su escritorio compuesto por una silL. y una mesa  plástica, ubicada al lado D. su chaza   D. madera, colmada  D. dulces y pasabocas, vendiendo a peatones, que por allí circulan y que últimamente han potencializando el que él, haya iniciado su otro negocio D.  servicio D. llamadas telefónicas.

Iván es un joven caribe D. naturaleza alegre y cordial, que forma parte D. L. Asociación D. vendedores del sur D. L. ciudad  “Asovesur” organización que agremia a todos los comerciantes estacionarios del sur D. BarranquilL., ubicados alrededor del centro comercial Metrocentro, próximos a ser reubicados en una galería en construcción dispuesta por el estado para continuar el proceso organizacional  D. sus zonas peatonales, que se viene gestando en L. ciudad. Su negocio  está ubicado en un sitio D. alta competencia muy bien aprovechado por él, porque  conoce a sus competidores  y sabe que D. sus interrelaciones depenD. su sostenibilidad y el mejoramiento D. su ingreso, como lo ha venido haciendo día a día.

 El pago D. su obligación en los 4 créditos a través D. L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, lo han  distinguido por su puntualidad; por esta razón está solicitando un credikiva para continuar incrementando sus ventas, aumentar su capital D. trabajo y mejorar su nivel D. vida familiar, como hasta ahora lo ha venido haciendo. Con este financiamiento está interesado en adicionar planes D. celulares y comprar productos D. cigarrería en general.   En el futuro planea obtener su vivienda propia a través del programa sueños y oportunidades, en L. urbanización  villas D. San Pablo, para lo cual   L. F.M.S.D. trabaja en L. postulación al subsidio estatal y gestiona su proceso D. crédito  para hacer el  cierre financiero D. su vivienda.
texts.en:
You will find Ivan every day from 7:00am until late at night, in an open location on Murillo Avenue, near important commercial centers of the city of BaranquilL., feeling the refreshing heat of the traD. winds that favor the city in distinct seasons. He will be seated at his 'desk', composed of a plastic chair and table, alongsiD. his wooden display filled with sweets and snacks, selling to pedestrians who circulate there. The latter have also provided potential that motivated him to start his other business, offering telephone calling plans. Ivan is a young Carib, by nature happy and cordial, who belongs to “Asovesur”, the organization that brings together all the stationary merchants located around BaranquilL.'s 'Metrocentro', its commercial center. They will soon be relocated to a gallery in construction as ordered by the state, as part of the city's pedestrian zone organizing process. Ivan's business is located where there is much competition and he takes advantage of that. He knows his competitors and understands that his sustainability depends upon interrelations with them, as does increasing his income, which is occurring day to day. Ivan's punctual repayment of his 4 loans with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo have distinguished him. For this reason, he is now soliciting a Kiva loan to continue increasing his sales, augmenting his working capital, and to continue improving his family's standard of living, as he has been doing up to now. With this loan he wants to acquire additional cellular phone plans and to buy the products generally needed by a tobacconist's shop. In the future he plans to obtain his own home through the 'Sueños y Opportunidades' (Dreams and Opportunities) program in Villas D. San Pablo, by means of which the Foundation works with state subsidies to offer loans to assist with the financial closing for dwellings.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ADDING CELL PHONE PLANS AND BUYING PRODUCTS SUCH AS SWEETS, AND A VARIETY OF SNACKS TO SELL

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn L. is from the village of Santo Domingo, Alicia, Isabela. She is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she  owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $90 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Babylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Babylyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Tursun's Group

texts.en: Tursun S. is leader of the group. She is 57 and married. She has three children. Her elder son is 26, her daughters are 24 and 22. Her elder son works in Russia and her daughters are going to graduate from an institution of higher education. Her husband is a farmer. She breeds cattle with the help of her husband. She started cattle breeding 39 years ago after her marriage with a purchase of cattle for 4,000 soms. For now, she could increase her turnover to 135,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase fuels and lubricants in order to prepare hay for the cattle. In the near future, she is planning to marry off her son and daughters. Group members: Zhyparinca T. is treasurer of the group. She is 31 and married. She has four children. Her sons are 12, 10 and 6 years old and her daughter is 4 years old. Her two elder sons go to school and her two youngest children are at home. Her husband works in Russia. She breeds cattle. She started cattle breeding 10 years ago when her husband sent from Russia to Kyrgyzstan 12,000 soms. She purchased cattle. For now, she could purchase a house and cattle on the profits from cattle breeding and increase her profits to 3,000 soms. She is applying for a loan in order to make capital repairs to her house before the winter period. In the near future, she is planning to give her children a higher education and increase cattle quantity. Meilikan E. is 38 and a widow. She has five children. Her daughters are 19 and 8 years old and her sons are 17, 14 and 12 years old. Her elder daughters work as shop assistants and all the other children go to school. Meilikan sells rice in the local market. She started 17 years ago with a purchase of a sack of rice for 165 soms. For now, she could increase her turnover to 76,400 soms and her profits to 4,300 soms. In line with selling rice, Meilikan is a farmer. Her children help her with farming in their free time. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase fuel and lubricants to prepare the soil for sowing. In the near future, she plans to provide for her children and give them a higher education. Meerimgul T. is 25 and married. She has three children. Her son is 6 years old and her daughters are 4 and 1. All her children are at home now. Her husband is a constructor. She is a farmer. She started farming four years ago with the purchase of a plot for 10,500 soms and began sowing rice. For now, she could start construction of her house, purchase cattle and increase her monthly income to 3,000 soms. She decided to breed cattle. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cattle for breeding. She is planning to continue construction of her house and to increase cattle quantity. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and lubricants in order to prepare hay for cattle

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men S., 37, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. S. sells pork, frog meat, and fermented fish for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband recharges batteries, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 30 on public transportation, and USD 15 on children’s education every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike in order to transport the meat she has to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: essohanam est une femme très dynamique, elle a 36 ans et est mariée avec 3 enfants. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. elle a une ancienneté de 11 ans dans ce commerce. elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de lomé. le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne peut satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle. elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de 36 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en: Essohanam N. is a very energetic woman, She is 36 years and is married with 3 children. Her income-generating business is selling bags of charcoal. She has 11 years of experience in this business. She gets her supplies in Lomé's local markets. Her currently available stock cannot meet the needs of her customers. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to purchase 36 bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other items needed for a tailoring business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 37-year-old married mother blessed with three children, John, James, and Jeremy, all of whom are dependent and in need of her support. This situation is the reason Cecilia wants to expand her existing charcoal sales business.

Her business started when she joined Ahon Sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). Although the sale of charcoal earns income, it only supports the family's daily needs, not other expenses such as the education of her three children. Cecilia really dreams of her children earning college degrees through her hard work and, of course, with the help of her husband. That is why she is requesting her sixth loan from Ahon Sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), which she will use for the expansion of her ventures. She wants to buy more charcoal to earn more income.

Cecilia also plans to begin a hog-fattening business in order to earn a much higher income. She really wants a better life for her family, and that is why she never stops seeking ways to achieve it.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia Q., 53, a widow who raised her four working children and one elementary child in GMA, Cavite, Philippines.  With the help of her four working children, she works hard daily to earn a living and able to send her youngest child even up to college.

At present, Leticia focuses on running her sari-sari (variety) store. She aims to meet the daily needs of her neighborhood in soft drinks and grocery items such as shampoo, and also canned goods, and seasonings, among others. With this business, Leticia earns an average of Php 300 a day.

Leticia knows inside her that the sari-sari store will not be enough to meet the needs and wants of her family. To help her continue operation of her variety store, she would like to apply for a Php 25,000 loan. She plans to use this money to add more items to her store and keep the small business in shape. In just a small period of time, she intends to turn her small sari-sari store into a real grocery store, with more items to meet the needs of people in her community.

All that Leticia dreams of in life is to make her family happy and give them a house they can call their own. She gives her best to make sure her youngest child gets a good education up through college. Life is not always sweet, but with all the efforts she is making for her family, she sees to it that she will emerge a winner, bringing home sweet success.  Leticia faithfully attends weekly fellowship* meetings. 


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: additional stock for variety store

loans.name: Sokry

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokry U. (pictured with her husband) is 54 years old and her husband, Mr. Oeun Sim is 53 years old. They have been married since 1979 and have four children--one son and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, another one is a garment factory worker, and two attend school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sokry is a farmer; she grows green beans on her farmland in the village. Her husband has been selling cows and oxen for almost 30 years; he buys them from other villages and nearby districts and sells to a middleman who comes to buy them at his home. 

Sokry is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide her husband with capital to purchase more cows and oxen for resale.

loans.use: To provide her husband with capital to purchase more cows and oxen for resale

loans.name: Sergio Jose

texts.es: Sergio tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de barbería. Hace más de 14 años que tiene este negocio pues es el único medio de vida que tiene a su alcance.  Inicia por sugerencias de amigos porque desde la edad de 20 años Sergio sabía perfectamente cortar pelo con el paso del tiempo decide establecer su propio establecimiento con el fin de proporcionar los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Este crédito es para la compra de tijera, peines, talcos entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Sergio has 2 children. He works at his barbershop. He has had this business for more than 14 years as this is the only way of life that he has available to him. He began the business from his friend's suggestions because since he was 20 years old Sergio has known how to cut hair perfectly. As time passed he decided to establish his own business in order to provide the necessary income for his household. This loan is to buy scissors, combs and talcum powder among other things.

loans.use: Capital for Work

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 30 years old and married with three children between the ages 4 and 10 years old. Jeannette sells new clothes, mainly wedding clothes. She has been in this business for about two years.  The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Jeannette will use this loan to purchase a variety of clothing styles for men and women.  With this loan, Jeannette envisions growing her business to such an extent that she can even start wholesaling.  Any profits from her expanded stock will be used for further business reinvestment, allowing her to continue to build a better future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua T. sells cassava, plantain and smoked fish in Elmina. She is married and has eight dependants. Her husband is a bar operator. She helps her husband with the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to reinvest her increased capital.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Yelba Mabel

texts.es:
DESCRIPCION: Yelba de 24 años de edad, Labora como secretaria en el Instituto Ruben Dario desde hace 5 años , tiene 2 niñas, su compañero de vida labora como docente de primaria él tambien se desempeña como docente universitario en la Universidad URACCAN el cual ayudara con el pago de sus cuotas ya que son una familia bien unida.  

Solicita su segundo crèdito a la Instituciòn mediante Kiva para  ponerle el  piso a su vivienda y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia,  segun referencias es bien responsables con sus compromisos.  

Su sueño es que sus hijas crezcan sanas y que su familia permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Yelba is 24 years old and has worked as a secretary for the Ruben Dario Institute for five years. She has two daughters. Her partner in life works as an elementary school teacher, but is also a college instructor at the University of the Autonomous Regions of the Nicaraguan Caribbean Coast (URACCAN). Their incomes help with the loan payments since they are a close family.

Yelba is requesting a Kiva loan, her second with AFODENIC, so that she can install a floor in her home. This will improve her living conditions, as well as those of her family. According to her references, Yelba is very responsible with her commitments.

Her dream is for her daughters to grow up healthy and to see her family remain together.

loans.use: Install a floor in her home

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is 43 years old. She has two daughters, aged 22 and 23, who are working and studying, and one granddaughter who is four years old. She is a member of the communal bank "Maria Celeste" and has been a member of FINCA Peru for five years now, after being invited by a friend. She has been selling candy from a mobile cart in Ayacucho for 17 years. She will be using her loan of 2,000 PEN to purchase sweets/candy at a wholesale market.

loans.use: To buy candy at the wholesale market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 31 años y nació en la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco. Ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a sus dos hijos. Vilma nos cuenta que en la comunidad que vive la gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella por ejemplo se dedica a la venta de animales como por ejemplo gallinas, chanchos,  ovejas,  y cuyes. Vilma también se dedica a la venta de cerveza en las festividades de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Vilma requiere le mcirocredito para comprar animales como por ejemplo cuyes.  

Vilma pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varias años.
texts.en:
Vilma is 31 years old and was born in the city of Urubamba, in Cusco department.  She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who works to get her two children ahead in life.  She tells us that the people in her community work in farming and livestock raising.  Vilma, for example, sells animals such as hens, pigs, sheep and guinea pigs.  She also sells beer at festivals in the city of Urubamba.  She has been in this business for four years and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Vilma requires her loan to buy animals such as guinea pigs.

Vilma is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen" community bank and has been working with her fellow bank members for several years.

loans.use: to buy animals such as guinea pigs

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old single man, working as a furniture maker. He lives in Bint Jbeil and has eight years of experience. He is committed to his work and is honest, energetic and hardworking.
 
This is Ali's third loan. He reports that the previous ones helped improve his business. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a generator. 

In the future, he wishes to expand his business and start a beautiful family.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
A skilled person in manicure and pedicure is our featured entrepreneur in this story. She is Mrs. Evangeline D., 41 years of age, married, and a resident of Maloro, Tangub City. She and her husband are blessed with four children who are all school aged. 

To help her husband, Evangeline decided to engage in a manicure and pedicure business. At this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than PHP 3,000 a month from her services rendered to her loyal customers and friends. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC 2 years ago because she is very much interested in our products and services. As a fourth cycle loaner, she has requested PHP 5,000 to be used in purchasing additional manicure and pedicure kits for her business. 

The future income from this business will be used for daily basic needs, savings and loan repayments. She is hoping that some day, all of her children will become successful in their education.

loans.use: to buy additional manicure kits for her manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Evengeline

texts.en:
Evengeline is 50 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a "Nipa" (palm leaf mat used for roofing and siding) business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of palm leaves to sell.

Evengeline has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the "Nipa" (palm leaf mat) business for 20 years and also earns income from Pig Fattening.

Evengeline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of "nipa" (palm leaf mats) to sell.

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es:
José, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 11 y 9 años de edad, él se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y lácteos, hace 5 años inicio el negocio como una fuente de ingreso permanente para su familia.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y frijol, también lácteos ya que vende queso y crema, con este préstamo podrá reforzar el negocio y tener una mejor solvencia para atender a los clientes y ganar más ingresos. 
La aspiración de José es algún día tener una fábrica de producción de queso y crema con esto mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
José lives in his own house with his wife and two children who are 11 and 9 years of age.  He sells basic grains and dairy products.  He started the business five years ago as a source of permanent family income.

He is asking for a loan to buy corn and beans and also dairy products since he sells cheese and cream.  With this loan he’ll be able to strengthen the business and have better solvency to tend to customers and earn more income.

José’s goal is to some day have a cheese and cream factory and improve his economic condition with this.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la carpintería, este oficio lo inicio cuando trabajó en un carpintería, actualmente trabaja en lo propio y no tiene un horario fijo para trabajar.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprar madera, pegamento, barniz, clavos y más materiales para la carpintería y elaboración de muebles, esta compra le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para ejecutar sus pedidos y mejorar los productos a los clientes.
Su sueño es tener un negocio amplio, con mayor cobertura, tener la oportunidad de distribuir para los comerciales de la zona.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his family, his wife and two children.  He is in the carpentry business.  He started this trade when he worked in a carpenter's workshop.  Now he works in his own workshop and does not work fixed hours.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy wood, glue, varnish, nails and other materials he needs for his carpentry business and making furniture.  This purchase will help him to have everything he needs to complete his orders and improve the products he makes for his customers.

Luis' dream is to have a large business with better coverage.  He would like to have the opportunity to distribute his products to businesses in his area.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, varnish and nails

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her duties very efficiently. 

Her husband operates a grocery store in the nearby market. Through his store, he sells daily use items like sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. His rates are very reasonable, that's why he has good number of clients in his area. 

Her husband wants to purchase groceries in bulk for his store; that's why Shaheen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. The loan investment will help him in fulfilling the needs of his clients and earn a better income. 

He has been operating his business for the past five years and Shaheen hopes that after the loan investment his business will grow further and his profits will be improved. 

Note: in the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Shaheen.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Gratien

texts.fr: Gratien est commerçant, il est Rwandais il est le client d’ACB depuis 2010,il est marie, il a 49ans, il a 2 enfants entre 4 ans et 7 ans et tous vont à l’école, il a une seul personne en charge. Il a niveau d’étude de 6 ans de primaire c’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB.il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter  1200 kgs de miels pour revendre et payer la main d’oeuvre.il n ya pas des difficultés attendu  de non –remboursement du credit.sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est améliore les services pour conquérir la marche.ses ambitions il voudrait devenir un grand distributeur des miels dans des différentes alimentations dans son région, et pour sa famille il voudrait payer le minerval de ses enfants et assure le développement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gratien is a merchant. He is Rwandan and has been a client of ACB since 2010. He is married, 49 years old, and has two children who are four and seven years old. Both go to school. He is the only breadwinner. 

He went to primary school for six years, and this is his second loan with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy 1200 kilograms of honey for resale and pay for labor. No difficulty with repayment is expected.

His strategy for growing his business is to improve his service to win over the market. As for his ambition, he would like to become an important distributor of honey in the various grocery stores in his region, and for his family, he would like to pay school fees for his children and ensure the development of his family.

loans.use: to buy 1200 kgs of honey for resale and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mallku Irpiri Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MALLKU IRPIRI” iniciará el ciclo número seis en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Noelia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: fabrica de encuadernación, plomería, chofer, chaperia, comedera, costura de chamarras y mochilas y venta de calzados.
 
La señora Noelia indica que hace seis años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de fabricación de encuadernados.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de carton, cuero, etc.) los que compra de la distribuidora y lo venderá en su empleada. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro del préstamo y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The "Mallku Irpiri" communal bank is starting its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch Central Office. It has eight members and is governed by a board of directors, headed by Mrs. Noelia. The members' businesses are varied and include: bookbinding, plumbing, driving, vehicle repair, a canteen, sewing jackets and backpacks, and shoe sales.

Noelia says that she has belonged to a Pro Mujer communal bank for six years, after receiving an invitation from a friend. She currently has a bookbinding business.

The loan that she is now taking out is for increasing her capital (purchasing carton, leather, etc), buying from a distributor and selling once it is all together. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family where possible. She lives with her partner and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the loan savings and the training.

loans.use: to purchase carton and leather

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mr.Prak tries to do everything to feed the family and live in happiness. He thinks at night with his wife that he wishes to open a small business in his village to transport firewood to sell in his village. His wife plants crops. When she takes time away from farming, she always sells fish in one market near her village. Both of them earn about $6 per day. To earn a good living standard like the rich family near his house, Mr.Prak would like to ask for $300 for the purpose of purchasing a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda is 30 years old and married. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has lovingly and patiently taken good care of her 5 school-aged children. Maylinda, together with her husband, has been selling lumber for 5 years. The couple is gradually acquiring business related facilities to improve the services offered. The business gives a monthly cash inflow of PHP 20,000. 

Maylinda has to sustain her livelihood as it is the sole source of income for the household. In 2008, she became an official GDMPC member. This loan, amounting to PHP 50,000, is the 13th loan application she has had with GDMPC. She intends to purchase lumber supplies to update her service offerings. Maylinda hopes to produce a variety of lumber supplies for sale and to innovate the business sales area.

loans.use: to purchase lumber facilities to update service offerings.

loans.name: Ganselem

texts.en:
Mr. Ganselem requested a loan to increase his business output. He is 40 years old, a shoe seller, and lives with his daughter and wife in Ulaanbaatar-the capital city of Mongolia. 

For 11 years he has been running his business in persistent way and has gained much experience in this field. He is a very sensitive businessman and a new  academic year is starting soon, which means there will be a lot of shoes necessary and a lot of purchases from his shoes kiosk. 

He feels that if he can increase his business' current assets, likewise his income is going to increase slowly. Now he needs to buy a large number of shoes from his suppliers.

loans.use: To buy a large number of shoes to increase his sales and current assets.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse has operated his auto garage for the last ten years.  He is 47 years old, married to Priscah, and they have two school children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy spray paint and spanners for his garage.

In future, he hopes to grow his garage and be a one-stop, where he can do everything at his place.

loans.use: To buy  spray paint and spanners.

loans.name: Shuru's Group

texts.en:
Shuru is the leader of this group.  She is 59 years old and married to a farmer. Shuru is a heroic mother; she has raised six daughters and two sons. All the children except the youngest son are married and live separately with their families. The family is engaged in livestock breeding and cultivation of agricultural products. With money received from the loan Shuru wants to purchase more livestock for breeding.  In the future she wants to increase the number of livestock, which will lead to an improvement of the family’s welfare.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nelvia Modesta

texts.es:
Nelvia, una joven, de 27 años de edad, originaria de una comunidad llamada las Leches ubicada en Chacaraseca municipio de  León,  tiene 2 hijos , es amad de casa y al mismo tiempo trabaja en la agricultura. Ella empezó a trabajar en la agricultura a la edad de 10 años con sus padres, pues ellos también eran agricultores, al casarse siguió trabajando en la siembra de Yuca junto con su esposo. Ella comercializa su producto en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de León. Baja de la montaña a la ciudad para poder vender su producto.
Ella realizo el crédito para sembrar yuca, comprar insumos para siembra. Con esta inversión le facilitares las herramientas y materiales para sembrar mas fácilmente, pues ella quiere que su cosecha se extienda , para poder producir mas y comercializarlo en los diferentes tipos de mercado.
texts.en:
Nelvia is a young women of 27, and has two children. She is from the community of Las Leches, located in the Chacaraseca municipality of León department.  She is a housewife and farms at the same time.  

She began farming at the age of ten with her parents, who were also farmers. When she got married, she continued growing yucca alongside her husband. She sells her crop in the municipal market of the city of León. She comes down from the mountains to sell her crop.

She took out the loan in order to plant yucca, and to buy the farming supplies needed for planting. The loan will enable her to buy tools and materials to plant more easily. She wants to expand her crop, in order to produce more and sell it in different kinds of markets.

loans.use: To plant yucca, and to buy farming supplies for planting.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn, 32, lives in the Philippines and is married with one child. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages, a business she has had for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Juvelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Harriet has a shop that sells film, cameras and phone batteries.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works six days out of every week. Harriet sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Harriet has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy phone batteries, cameras, film and sole tape. The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully-stocked dairy and to educate her children. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more phones, cameras, batteries, film and sole tape.

loans.name: Nabangala B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nabangala B Group in Western Kenya! Elina is the facilitator of the Nabangala B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. Elina joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Elina had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elina was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elina and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. 

With income from maize sales Elina will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Nabangala B group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives in the Philippines. Teresita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and  rice per kilogram, which she has been doing for five years. 

Teresita is requesting a loan for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and sacks of rice. Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Marta Lucia

texts.es: La señora Marta a sus 50 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida rápida en las horas de la tarde y fines de semana, en las horas de la mañana vende productos fritos en general como empandas, buñuelos, y pasteles. La señora Marta se caracteriza por la calidad y buen sabor  en los productos que elabora. La señora Marta aprendió este oficio de manera autónoma, ella misma estudio de enciclopedias y de los consejos de su abuela las recetas. Actualmente, la señora Marta desea comprar una nueva olla para freír sus productos y así aumentar la agilidad y buena manipulación en los alimentos a freír. Con lo anterior, la señora Marta podrá aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera seguir brindando a su familia una buena calidad de vida y educación. La señora Marta sueña con tener otro punto de venta de comidas y ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en: Marta, 50, makes fast food to sell during the evening and on weekends.  In the morning she sells fried food in general like turnovers, buñuelos [fried flour tortillas with sugar and cinnamon] and cakes.  Marta stands out because of the quality and good flavor of the products she makes.  Marta taught herself how to make these items studying in encyclopedias and following her grandmother’s recipes and advice.  Currently, Marta would like to buy a new fryer for her products to increase her speed and handling of the food while frying.  With this, Marta will be able to increase income and continue to provide her family with a good quality of life and education.  Marta dreams with having another food stand and to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a fryer and supplies like flour, vegetables and sauces.

loans.name: Shikamulo Farmers Group

texts.en:
Julius is the facilitator of the Shikamulo Farmers group. Julius and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Julius and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Julius is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, he had a good maize yield harvesting 4 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Julius was only able to harvest 1/2 a bag of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, Julius will educate his children and save for future use. 

In 2012, the members of Shikamulo Farmers group will each plant maize on between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Unidos Somos Más (Junin) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unidos Somos Mas  se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente de la provincia y del  Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace 4 meses y  formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, comercio, entre otras actividades. Están muy contentos con la ayuda recibida con su primer crédito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen  dos hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella además de ser una gran madre y ama de casa realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en la agricultura que es a lo que la familia se dedica, ellos siembran en  invierno maíz, maní, verduras entre otras cosas, en la actualidad están trabajando en la preparación de la tierra para que cuando caigan las primeras aguas sembrar y así obtener una muy buena cosecha.

Este crédito lo van  a emplear en pagar sueldos de la gente que prepara la tierra para los sembríos, adema de semillas y químicos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la forma como se trabaja en  la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener una muy buena cosecha y que el invierno sea muy bueno. 

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que está en la foto del grupo, pero, como no le ve muy bien el rostro tuvimos que adjuntar ésta foto pequeña. Los niños de la foto son hijos de las socias.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Unidos Somos Más, meets every fifteen days in the city of Junín.  This place is known for its friendly and hardworking people because this region makes the best liquor, "aguardiente," in the province and in Ecuador.  

These group of individuals decided to unite and form this communal bank over four months ago, which has helped them profusely with these credits.  They have been able to improve their small businesses because of them.  They also work in different areas, such as agriculture and business.  They are very happy with the help that they have received with their first credit.

It's here that we meet Señora Ana, who is 40 years old and married with two children, aged 12 and 9 years old, both of whom are students.  Her husband works in agriculture.  Aside from being a great mother and housewife, she is applying for this credit so that her husband may utilize with their agriculture, which is what her family works in.  They harvest corn, peanuts, and vegetables, amongst other things, in the winter.  Currently, they are working in the preparation of the soil so that when the first rains fall, they will obtain a better harvest.

This credit will be used to pay the salaries of the people that prepare the soil for the growing season, in addition to seeds and chemicals.  This is their second cycle in the Communal Bank and they enjoy it because of the way it works.  Their dream is to have a great harvest and have the winter turn out wonderfully.  

The attached photo is of one of the members that is in the group picture.  Since you couldn't see the face too well, we had to attach this tiny photo.  The children in the photo are her children.

loans.use: pay wages and purchase seeds and chemicals.

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en: Zumrud is a 46-year-old married woman with two children. She's been growing seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 7 years. During autumn, winter and spring she primarily grows pumpkins. Pumpkin is a very popular product, and people consider it as one of the healthiest. People use it in national dishes such as qutab and pilau. One of the main positive features of pumpkin is that it can stand for more than two months and not rot. Zumrud usually sells her crops in the central bazaar as well as to neighbors. Her monthly income is 350 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). Now Zumrud wants to increase the number of products she sells. She needs additional capital to invest in her business to buy seeds and fertilizers. AqroInvest Credit Union provided her with a 1000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Richel

texts.en: Richel is 24 years old and married with two children. She is from the city of Kinuman, Ozamis City. To make a living, Richel owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting root crops to sell. Richel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. Richel joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel is requesting a loan of 8,600 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: El sr. Víctor, es un cliente nuevo que vino a la institución por la invitación de su hermana, Gregoria, el Sr. Víctor vive en la zona Alto Chijini, de la ciudad de La Paz, el se dedica a la confección  de chamarras vive con su esposa y un hijo, el crédito es para la compra de una maquina over looc de cinco hilos para la confección de sus prendas de vestir, le esta yendo muy bien  en esta actividad por el buen trabajo que realiza,  entrega a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz, y su deseo es poder llevar sus productos a distintos departamentos como Oruro y Potosí ya que las chamarras por el clima frio tienen gran demanda en esas ciudades, se siente muy feliz el Sr. Víctor por la oportunidad que le brindan, es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación.
texts.en: Víctor is a new client who came to the institution invited by his sister, Gregoria.  Víctor lives in the city of La Paz’s Alto Chijini zone.  He makes jackets.  He lives with his wife and a son.  The loan is to buy a five thread overlock sewing machine to make the articles of clothing.  He’s doing very well in this activity thanks to the good work he does.  He sells to various markets in the city of La Paz and his wish is to take his products to various other departments like Oruro and Potosí because cold weather jackets are in high demand in these cities.  Víctor feels very happy because of the opportunity he’s being given; he’s an enterprising person who very much wants to improve.

loans.use: to buy a five thread overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina, is a 26 year old woman. She is working at a store for few years ago and form her saving, she has initiated a kiosk business at home based for 3 months ago. When Dina goes to work, her sister would help her in managing the business. That business place is close to a school and it has regular customer who are mostly students. Recently,  Dina wants to improve her kiosk by selling more snacks and beverages but she needs more capital to make it real. Therefore Dina joined with another member and requested a loan of amounting IDR 1,750,000 from TLM and ready to realize her idea for her business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks and beverages

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly N. has been an active member of LiA since october 2004, Milly joined with her skills as an artisan making mats and table mats from used straws which have been sold in the LiA gallery, bazaars and hawking them around by her children.

Milly was doing all this to increase on her family income but still there is alot she and her husband can't accomplish with the meagre incomes they get . Their family has expanded; when Milly joined LiA she had four children but now she has given birth to two more.

With her own income now that she is working at the new WE Center across the road from her home, Milly is finding herself newly empowered as a mother and a wife. She has decided that the house they live in is simply too small for 6 children. Her plan is to help the husband to enlarge their house so that they can have enough room to accommodate their big family they have now. She wants to add a bedroom and a living room to their one room they have been staying in.

To achieve this she needs a loan of Ushs. 800,000 and her budget is as follows:

  • Bricks 4000 @ Ushs.60 = 240,000
  • Iron Sheets 24pcs @Ushs. 11,000 = 264,000
  • Bags of Cement 10Pkts @Ushs.18500 = 185,000
  • Timber @Ushs. 60,000
  • Transport @Ushs. 40,000
  • Water @ Ushs.11,000

Total Ushs. 800,000

Milly's husband is a builder and he is ready to do the expansion of the house.

Milly has a surplus of Ushs.260,000 on her monthly expenses to enable her repay her loan in a period of 6 months at a rate of Ushs.147,335. She has designated the community impact portion of the interest she pays on this loan to support new lighting for the WE Center Member Gallery.

loans.use: Purchase of building supplies

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.en:
Mrs. Afiwa A. is a fifty year old widow. Her deceased husband’s inheritance is not sufficient to provide for the needs of her six children. In addition to her own children, she is also responsible for two young female apprentices. In order to take care of their needs, Mrs. A. has a pot manufacturing business that she inherited from her mother. Every Tuesday; market day in her village; she displays her products, which are held in high esteem.

Mrs. A. is currently requesting a loan of $800 to increase her production capacity. The loan will allow her to acquire the raw materials necessary to manufacture the pots. The income generated from her business will provide for the dietary, schooling and health needs of he children.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Afiwa est une veuve d’une cinquantaine d’année. L’héritage laissé par son mari défunt ne lui permet pas de subvenir aux besoins de ses six (06) enfants. En dehors de ses enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (02) jeunes filles en apprentissage. Pour arriver à s’occuper d’eux, Madame A. Afiwa exerce comme activité la fabrication des pots qu’elle a hérité de sa maman. Chaque mardi, jour du marché de sa localité, elle expose ses produits qui sont d’ailleurs très appréciés.

Elle sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $800 pour renforcer sa capacité de production. Le crédit servira à acquérir les matières premières nécessaires à la fabrication des pots. Les revenus qu’elle tirera de ce métier, serviront à subvenir aux besoins alimentaires, scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.

loans.use: To acquire the raw materials necessary to manufacture pots

loans.name: Evgeniya

texts.en:
If you’re a woman looking for shoes, clothing or something to decorate your home or dining room, make sure to stop by Evgeniya’s little store in Nikopol, Ukraine. She offers an attractive array of reasonably priced shoes, clothing, tablecloths and souvenirs. If she doesn’t have what you’re looking for, she can help you find someone who does.

Vendors like Evgeniya form the backbone of a prosperous market economy in Ukraine. These entrepreneurs have, often with little help, been able to start and sustain small businesses which provide enough income for them to live on. For many their goal is to expand by opening new kiosks or renting larger retail space. They may never be the size of Wal-Mart but they’ve started in much the same way.

Evgeniya has requested a six month loan for $500 which will give her some additional working funds for her business. She believes that God has blessed her through the financial help of “Nadiya Ukraine”. Thank you for being part of God’s blessing to the hard-working entrepreneurs of Ukraine.

Якщо ви шукаєте взуття, одяг, посуд або необхідні матеріали для декору інтер‘єру кухні, обов’язково зайдіть до невеличкої крамнички Євгенії в м. Нікополь. В неї ви знайдете різноманітний вибір взуття, одягу, скатертин та сувенірів за помірними цінами. Навіть якщо в неї ви не знайдете те, що шукаєте, Євгенія підкаже, де знайти того, хто зможе вам допомогти. Саме такі підприємці, як Євгенія, сприяють процвітанню ринкової економіки України. Ці бізнесмени відкрили власну справу, утрималися на плаву та отримали непоганий прибуток. Багато хто з них прагне розширити власний бізнес та відкрити нові кіоски або орендувати більші приміщення. Можливо, вони ніколи не досягнуть розмірів великих торгівельних центрів , але ж усі починають з малого. Євгенія просить про позику в 500 доларів строком на 6 місяців, бо сподівається отримати додаткові кошти на розвиток власного бізнесу. Вона переконана, що Бог благословив її завдяки фінансовій підтримці від „Надії України”. Євгенія дякує вам за те, що ви стали частиною Божого благословення в житті старанних підприємців в Україні.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es:
I have over 11 years of experience in the cheese-making business. This business, in which my husband and children also work, is our sole source of income. With the livestock we currently have, we can't produce enough cheese to satisfy customer demand. We are asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy livestock, raw materials, and equipment so that we can expand our line of products.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo ya mas de 11 años en el negocio de elaboración de quesos este negocio es el ingreso de la familia en el trabajamos mis hijos, esposo y yo. El ganado que tenemos ya no es suficiente para la elaboración de los quesos cada ves tenemos mas pedidos, es por eso que estamos solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para comprar ganado, materia prima y herramienta de trabajo para elaborar los quesos y hacer otros productos.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and equipment

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Mrs. Justina O. is 41 years old and married with 6 children. She sells clothes in her community. She has 20 years of experience in her business. She is requesting the above loan to enable her to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ni Putu Okayani

texts.id:
Like most people living in a village, Okayoni and family lives from farming. They rent / contract a 50 are (5000 square meters) land for Rp1,000,000 (about US$110)/year. Usually they planted all sorts of plants with short harvest, yet provide enough profit, like assortment of vegetables, as has been done in the last 6 months. With a loan for Rp3,500,000 (about US$385) Okayoni and husband I Ketut Sudi Utama plant long beans. This vegetable is selected by Okayoni to conform with current season, and the cost are not too high, and easy maintenance. Okayoni spends Rp2,850,000 (about $315) including payment to 3 women helpers trained to pick up the harvest after 45-65 days. Picking the beans were done once every 2 days, and each worker was paid Rp20,000 (about $2.20)/day. Expected sales in one harvest 3 month period (from planting till finish harvesting) was Rp4,800,000 (about US$530), so the profit within that 3 months was Rp1,950,000 (about $215). This helps Okayoni's family economy to pay for their 3 children's education expenses, who are all still in Grade school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagaimana umumnya orang yang hidup di desa, Okayoni dan keluarganya hidup dari hasil mengolah tanah pertanian . Tanah 50 are milik orang lain yang Okayoni sewa / kontrak selama setahun sebesar Rp 1.000.000,- Biasanya di tanami berbagai jenis tanaman yang masa panenya cepat namun dapat menghasilkan keuntungan yang lumayan misalnya jenis tanaman sayur –sayuran .Seperti apa yang di lakukannya sejak 6 bulan terakhir ini, Dengan modal yang di pinjam dari Dinari sebesar Rp 3.500.000,-Okayoni yang di bantu oleh I Ketut Sudi Utama, suaminya, menekuni menanam sayuran jenis kacang panjang. Sayuran ini di pilih Okayoni di sesuaikan dengan musim yang terjadi saat ini , juga karena biaya yang di perlukan tidak terlalu banyak dan perawatanya pun mudah. Dari sekitar 35 are tanah yang telah ditanami kacang panjang , Okayoni menghabiskan biaya sebesar Rp 2 .850.000,- biaya itu telah termasuk ongkos 3 orang pekerja wanita yang di ajak memetik hasil panen pada masa panen raya saat tanaman berumur 45 sampai dengan 65 hari. Pemetikan dilakukan setap 2 hari sekali . dan masing masing pekerja di bayar Rp 20.000, -/ harinya . Hasil penjualan yang di dapat Okayoni dalam satu periode masa panen yaitu 3 Bulan , ( dari mulai tanam sampai selesai panen ) sebesar Rp 4.800.000,- jadi keuntungan yang di dapat Okayoni dalam 3 Bulan sebesar Rp 1 .950.000,- . Hasil ini sangat membantu perekonomian keluarga Okayoni lebih- lebih dalam memenuhi biaya kebutuhan pendidikan 3 orang anaknya yang semua masih duduk di bangku sekolah dasar.

loans.use:
To buy long bean seeds, fertlizer and medicine

Membeli bibit kacang panjang, pupuk dan obat - obatan

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en: Mrs. Tuon H., age 33, works producing and selling mortar and pestles, making about US$2 a day in profit. Her husband is a carpenter who makes about US$10 a day in revenue. They have one child who is a student. Mrs. H. would like to receive a loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase a larger supply of rocks for mortar and pestle production, and to purchase an electric saw to make her husband more productive at his job. Investing in both of their businesses will lead to an increased income for the family, which will allow them to afford a better quality of life, pay for their child’s education, and re-invest in their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of rocks to produce more mortar and pestles, and purchase of an electric saw

loans.name: Teresa Teonila

texts.es:
Señora Teresa Teonila is 36-years-old, and she studied through high school. She has 2 children who still depend on her. She lives in the district of El Porvenir in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad. Teresa has a beauty salon where she offers hair cuts, hair coloring, and manicures. In addition to this, she travels to Lima to buy clothing and gifts like: stuffed animals, picture frames, and albums, which her clients often ask for, and with time, she has been able to obtain.

She is a member of the Víctor Raúl Communal Bank. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy mirrors and chairs for her beauty salon. Previously, Teresa worked weaving sweaters, but thanks to the first credit she received from her communal bank, she started her busines.

With this loan of 2,000 soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will travel to the city of Lima to buy stuffed animals, decorations, watches, toys, etc. These products are in great demand because of the holidays. Teresa dreams about seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Teresa Teonila tiene 36 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa. Tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el Distrito El Porvenir de la Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Teresa tiene un salón de belleza en el que ofrece servicio de corte de pelo, tinte para el cabello, cuidado de manos y cutis; además de eso, viaja a Lima a comprar ropa y regalos como: peluches, portarretratos, álbum's los cuales muchas veces son pedidos de sus clientes que con el tiempo ha conseguido.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Raúl”, su primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300.00 lo utilizó para comprar espejos y sillones para su peluquería. Anteriormente la señora Teresa trabajaba tejiendo chompas, gracias al primer crédito que recibió en su banco comunal empezó su nuevo negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 soles, que pagará en cuatro meses, viajará a la ciudad de Lima para comprar peluches, adornos, relojes, juguetes, etc., estos productos tienen gran demanda en estas fiestas de fin de año. La señora Teresa sueña con ver a sus hilos profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of decorations, watches, toys, etc.

loans.name: Agossou

texts.fr:
At the age of 46, Mr. Agossou A. is married and the father of 7 children. He is a farmer and also sells dried red chili peppers as a secondary business. His soil is becoming expended and capricious weather has contributed to make his harvests smaller and smaller. Since he has to support his family, he is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to get his dried chili pepper business up and running again. This amount will permit him to keep a constant stock available to sell in times of shortage. The income from this venture will allow him to take care of his family's needs and lead a peaceful life.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A l’âge de 46 ans, Monsieur A. Agossou est marié et père de sept (07) enfants. Cultivateur de profession, il fait aussi comme seconde activité la vente du piment séché. La dégradation de son sol et les caprices de la nature ont rendu son rendement de plus en plus médiocre. Etant dans l’obligation de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il sollicite un financement de $300 pour relancer son commerce de piments séché. Ceci lui permettra de faire un stockage consistant pour la vente en période de pénurie. Les revenus issus de la vente lui permettront de s’occuper de sa famille et de mener une vie paisible.

loans.use:
purchase dried chili peppers for re-sale and also fertilizer for his farm land

stockage de piment et achat d'engrais

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate A. is 30 years old, has 3 children, and comes from Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a fashion designer and has been in this business since 2006. She needs a loan of $275 to enable her to buy more cloth and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.use: To buy cloth and tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Mrs. Nao R. and her husband, Vuthy Cheng, have been married since 1987. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives in the family house and the other three children are in school. The family lives along Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Nao has been a silk weaver for ten years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man inside the village. Her husband has been raising pigs and producing rice wine for fifteen years. Now he wants to create another business and begin milling rice by machine.

Mrs. Nao is requesting a loan for the fifth time in the amount of $550 to purchase silk material for weaving. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy a milling rice machine.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to buy a milling rice machine

loans.name: Asia's Wisdom Group

texts.en:
Asia is married a woman with one child, aged 17 years old. Asia sells fish and chips, a business she started in 2001. Everyday, she works from 4am to 10pm and earns a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She plans to use this loan to buy more fish and irish potatoes to help her business. She will share this loan with her group members Emmakulata and Lydia, who work as a kiosk owner and a caterer. She thanks you in advance for her loan.

loans.use: To buy more fish and more irish potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba is a constant example of dedication and devotion. Ever since living in Juliaca she has worked hard so that her two daughters don't suffer from economic deprivation and can continue their university studies without worry. Currently, Elba has a candy kiosk located insiD. an education center located in Juliaca. In addition to this business, she, along with her dear niece, make delicious chocolates and picocas of quinoa that they distribute to be sold in various grocery stores in her town. Elba's wish is to have more capital to invest into her business and that's precisely why she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Elba, es un ejemplo constante D. dedicación y entrega, desD. que radica en la ciudad D. Juliaca trabaja arduamente con el fin D. que sus 2 hijas no pasen privaciones económicas y puedan seguir sin preocupaciones sus estudios superiores.Actualmente Elba tiene un quiosco D. golosinas ubicado al interior D. un centro educativo D. dicha ciudad, adicionalmente a este negocio en sociedad con su querida sobrina se dedica a elaborar deliciosos chocolates y picocas D. quinua que distribuyen para ser vendidas en las diferentes bodeguitas D. su localidad.El deseo D. Elba es contar con mayor capital e invertirlo en su negocio, precisamente a esta razón atienD. su solicitud D. préstamo.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase her production

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi A., 36, is married and the father of four children. For more than 7 years, he has been a shopkeeper in Avetonou, a little village situated about 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He hopes, with this loan, to increase the capacity of his business, buying some sacks of rice, cartons of sugar, cartons of milk, tinned foods, and soap for resale. This will allow him to satisfy the demands of his customers and make more profit in order to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Komi A. est âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il tient, depuis plus de 7 ans, une boutique à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire, avec ce crédit, augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des sacs de riz, des cartons de sucres, des cartons de lait, des boîtes de conserves et des savons pour la revente. Ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et de tirer plus de profits pour l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille

loans.use:
Purchase sacks of rice, cartons of sugar, cartons of milk, tinned food, and soap for re-sale

Acheter des sacs de riz, des cartons de sucres, des cartons de lait, des boîtes de conserves et des savons pour la revente

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa owns 3 motorcycle taxis and sells chicken feed for a living. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are still in school. One of the motorcycle taxis is driven by her husband, Oswaldo. This couple works in unity in order to help their children pursue higher education. Oswaldo is in charge of the motorcycles, while Rosa manages the business. In the future, they wish to open a lube center. Therefore, Rosa is requesting this loan in order to give her motorcycle taxis maintenance, purchase spare parts, and rent a business space in which to sell motor oil.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es propietaria de 3 motocarros y también se dedica a la venta de comida para pollos, ella tiene 5 hijos, 2 de ellos aún estudiantes.Uno de los motocarros es manejado por su esposo, Oswaldo, esta pareja trabaja en unidad para brindarle a sus hijos, estudios universitarios.
