Oswaldo, está al cuidado de las motos y Rosa es quien administra el negocio.En adelante tienen el deseo de abrir un lubricentro, para ello Rosa solicita el presente préstamo para dar mantenimiento a sus motocarros, comprar algunos repuestos que necesitan y alquilar un local para la venta de lubricantes. Apoya a esta pareja a continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Give maintenance to/purchase spare parts for motorcycle taxis, and rent a business space for motor oil sales

loans.name: Grimanesca

texts.es:
Grimanesca belongs to Las Románticas Community Bank located in AA.HH Manantay Jr. Ucayali MzLL Lt.3 in the San Fernando District of the Department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, the mother is 4 children and a widow. Grimanesca decided to invest her first S/. 300 loan from Manuela Ramos in charcoal sales. At the present time she continues with this charcoal business. Grimanesca gets up very early to build her fires so that she can make her charcoal. With this loan of S/ 700.00, which will be paid over 4 months, she will buy 3 truckloads of firewood. Grimanesca does not get discouraged as she moves forward and is very thankful to the institution because with the loan that she received she has been able to grow her business and she also could help pay for one of her daughter’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Grimanesca, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Románticas, ubicado en el AA.HH Manantay Jr. Ucayali MzLL Lt.3, del Distrito de San Fernando, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años es madre de 4 hijos, es viuda. Grimanesca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en venta de carbón. En la actualidad continua con el negocio de carbón. Grimanesca se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus volcanes para que pueda hacer su carbón. Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 3 camionadas de leña. Grimanesca no desmaya sigue adelante y esta muy agradecida con la institución por que con el préstamo que recibió le ayudo a crecer más su negocio y también le pudo ayudar a pagar sus estudios a una de sus hijas.

loans.use: To buy firewood wholesale.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn L., 49, lives in Serey Sokhom Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory and another child helps with the famiL. farm. The remaining two are attending school.

She and her husband, Mr. Korng Savann, own one field where they can grow potatoes. Their field is three hectares which is too large for them to cultivate potatoes without assistance. Mrs. Phorn L. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in the field. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the field and cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 24 años, vive con su madre y su hijo pequeño de 4 años.  Es una joven madre de familia que tiene deseos de superación, hace 3 años, decidió asociarse con su tía  para  atender juntas su restaurante, desde ese entonces, atiende todo tipo de bufetes, de pedidos para eventos sociales y ceremonias diversas. Su trabajo es diario, y lo disfruta, porque le permite disponer de su propio tiempo, además de atender a su hijo, aunque a veces, lo difícil es lavar gran cantidad de platos, después de cada venta en el restaurante.  Mónica trabaja cada día, motivada para dar lo necesario a su pequeño y para que ella misma pueda sostenerse.  Solicita este crédito, con el que podrá cubrir los pedidos de buffet que tiene, ya que primero brinda el servicio y después cobra, por lo que tiene que tener un capital previo. Mónica desea en el futuro tener sucursales de su negocio y expandir su mercado de trabajo.
texts.en:
Monica is 24, lives with her mom and her small 4 year old son. She is a young mother that wishes to get better, three years ago, she joined her aunt to work together in her restaurant, since then, she serves all types of catering, orders for social events and various ceremonies. She works daily and enjoys it, because it allows her to do it on her own time and take care of her son, even though some times it’s hard to wash all the dishes after every meal at the restaurant. She requests this loan, to cover some catering orders because she gets paid after providing the service, reason why she needs the money. Monica wishes to have more locations of her business and expand her sales market.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incrementar su capital de trabajo para el servicio de buffet que ofrece.

loans.name: Arrieros Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Arrieros esta integrado por personas que viven en el distrito D. Carmen Alto que se encuentra en L. ciudad D. Huamanga, zona tradicional en donD. antiguamente vivían los arrieros y también es una zona artesanal en donD. se elaboran textiles, nombre que adquiere el Banco Comunal. 
El Banco Comunal Arrieros se inicia con 16 socias, muchas D. ellas fueron invitadas por L. promotora, algunas D. las socias son vecinas y familiares.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como venta D. comida, cereales, quesos, carnes, animales menores, abarrotes y algunos son artesanos textiles.
Muchas D. ellas venden sus productos ambulatoriamente, D. casa en casa, sus talleres se ubican en sus domicilios y las ventas los realiza en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Huamanga.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos D. 300, 600, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 9500 soles en el Banco Comunal.
Los prestamos será invertidos en L. compra D. cerdo, carnero, trigo, cebada, arroz, azúcar, quesos, tintes, lanas.
Los sueños D. las socias es ampliar sus negocios, establecer su negocio en un solo lugar  y sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank 'Arrieros' is maD. up of people who live in the district of Carmen Alto, which is located in the city of Huamanga, a region where muleteers have traditionally lived. It is also an artisan region where textiles are maD.. This is why the Bank is called as it is. The Communal Bank 'Arrieros' was started by 16 members; most of them were invited by the leader. Some of the members are neighbors and family members. The members perform many different activities such as selling food, cereals, cheese, beef, young animals, groceries and some are textile artisans. Many of them sell their products door to door; their workshops are located at their homes, and they also sell their goods at the market of the city of Huamanga. The members need different amounts of money (300, 600, 900 Soles); a total of 9500 Soles for the Communal Bank. The loans will be invested in purchasing pigs, goat, wheat, flour, rice, sugar, cheese, ink, and wool. The dreams of these members is to expand their businesses, to establish a store in a permanent address, and for their children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs, goat, wheat, flour, rice, sugar, cheese, ink, and wool.

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Mrs. Chhom P. lives in Angk village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Touch Khuon, own land and cultivate rice with a lot of hard work to earn money. They do not have much money to support their farm. Thus, Mrs. Chhom P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on their field. She is 55 years old and the mother of five children. Two of her children are employed in garment factory, another is a farmer, and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on her field

loans.name: Nhep

texts.en: Nhep S. is 52 years old and lives in Pursat Province. He earns a living by repairing motorcycles and bicycles. He is also a rice farmer, a business he started in 1990. His wife is a rice farmer as well and raises poultry at home for a profit. She is a good mother of three children, all of whom are single and help her with the farming work. Mr. S. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase motorcycle parts, like wheels etc.and a new investment, a motorcycle washing machine. S. appears in the picture of his workshop.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts and a motorcycle washing machine

loans.name: Djitré

texts.fr: Cette dame réside dans le quartier d’avédji elavagnon, elle fait le commerce de charbons de bois, elle vend en détail et en gros, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1994, elle a besoin de nouveaux stocks de marchandises c’est pour cela qu’elle a sollicité auprès de WAGES un crédit de 500000 pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée et à 03 enfants , son mari est un chauffeur.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Avédji Elavagnon neighborhood. She sells charcoal retail and also wholesale. She has been in this business since 1994. She needs to replenish her inventory and for that reason she has requested from WAGES a loan in the amount of 500,000 F to buy sacks of charcoal. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a chauffeur.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Raha

texts.en:
Raha has been a seamstress and a juice and phone seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. 
She belongs to Asaakher loan group (Group code 2017).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can increase her inventory for her business. 
She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.  

Raha is 43 years old, married, and has four children: aged 21, 15, 11 and 8.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama Ataa-Asomani is married and the mother of one girl. She is 50 years old. Her child is in the basic school. Ama lives with the daughter and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town) in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai are into commercial activities. Her husband runs a provisions store, while she is a seamstress by profession.

She buys fabrics and other accessories from Kumasi and sews items for sale. She also sews for clients who come with their own materials. She says she procures the materials and sews for people who place orders but pay no deposit amount. Ama’s shop is located at the market square. She has been in business for over 20 years and has trained a number of apprentices who have graduated and are running their own businesses. She still has some apprentices who are under training.

Ama says she wants a loan to buy a variety of materials in bulk. It is her dream to help her husband put up a structure for the family and give their child the best education.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg T. is a single mother who lives with her 11 year-old son in Uvurhanghay province, one of the southern provinces of Mongolia.

In 2004, the government laid off a significant number of high school teachers due to a structural change in the higher education of Mongolia. Erdenetsetseg was one of them. After the layoff, she started a small retail business in school related products such as pens, pencils and notebooks. She purchases the products from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar..

Since she was a high school teacher, she knows what school children need during the school season. Maybe because she used to work in education, she hopes to make sure that her only child receives the best possible education. Her dream is to send her son to one of the best universities in the world. She requests a loan to purchase more products for her retail shop.

loans.use: Buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Lucinda A. lives in the municipality of Bugasong in beautiful Antique Province. Antique is a coastal, mountainous province on the west side of the island of Panay; its economy is heavily dependent on fishing and farming. Lucinda is 65 years old and is married to Salvador, who is a farmer. They do not have any children.

Lucinda started her business selling dried saltfish and shrimp paste at market only recently. She found initial support for her endeavor when she became a member of Kiva partner Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2008, and is now on her second loan cycle.

She plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more fishing materials, including rope, nets, floats and weights, and nylon line. Lucinda processes the fish she catches, drying them for sale at public market.

She hopes to generate enough income from her business to be able to help support her nephews' education. She also wants to save money in order to be financially stable when she and her husband are no longer able to work. Lucinda's ambition will help her achieve these goals: she wants to buy a motorized fishing boat some day, and plans to further expand her fishing operation.

loans.use: Fishing supplies such as rope, nets, weights and floats, and nylon line.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: William needs a loan of 1500 soles, which he'll invest in rooster feed and tournament registration fees.

loans.name: Narcedelia

texts.es: La señora Narcedelia Galván desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y artículos para el hogar, ahora ella recurre ya que ella quiere innovar mas su negocio desea comprar mas mercancía nueva para ofrecerle a los clientes. Así tendrá más ventas y aumentara más sus ingresos. El esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos y le manda la mercancía o ella va a comprarla hasta la ciudad donde el se encuentra o ya sea en otras ciudades.
texts.en:
For nine years, Mrs. Narcedelia Galván has sold used clothes and articles for the home. Now she wants to innovate her business. She wants to buy more new merchandise to offer to her clients. This way, she will have more sales and will increase her income more. Her husband works in the United States and sends her merchandise or she buys it in her city or in other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Nara Yin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people living in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Nara Y. is the 30-year-old village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store in her house. Her husband, Mr. Tang Lorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows vegetables. Even though they try hard, they still earn less income than they need, so they face an obstacle to get enough food for the family. Thus, Mrs. Nara Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy food for her family. She has a child who is just four years old.

Mr. Chandara G. did not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she decided to ask for the loan instead. 

All but one member in the group have monthly payment loans. One member has an end-of-term loan and is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy food for her family

loans.name: Tiomai

texts.en:
Tiomai F., 46, is married with six children. She has many years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers two days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). She has two previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Tiomai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is very appreciative of the financial help she gets from the SPBD program in supporting her family through her business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and equipment needed for her business

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мамлакат кредитор в организации несколько лет.Она берёт кредиты на увеличение ассортимента мужской, женской одежды и обуви.Следующий кредит Мамлакат хочет использовать на завоз мужской летней обуви.В день мониторинга Мамлакат отсутствовала, была в отъезде за товаром.Поэтому на снимке её муж продаёт мужскую обувь
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mamlakat has been our client for several years. She takes loans to increase the assortment of men's and women's clothing and shoes. Her next loan Mamlakat wants to use to bring in men's summer shoes. During the screening Mamlakat was absent, she was out buying the merchandise. This is why her husband is on the picture selling men's shoes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand shoe sales business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda manages a hog-raising business in her rural village of Siempre Viva in Malig, Isabela. She is blessed with four children: Francisco B. Jr., Framelyn Jay, Fannica Kriza Joyce, and Fe Kristel. Due to lack of financial capital, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP through Kiva, which she will use to buy sacks of feed for her hogs. Her husband, Francisco, is a simple farmer, and his income is not enough because most of his harvest goes to traders from whom he gets most of the farm inputs he uses in farming.

Imelda is thankful that she is able to maintain her hog-raising business to help meet her family's needs, especially sending the children to school. Imelda hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request to benefit her family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed for her pigs

location.town: Siempre Viva in Malig, Roxas, Isabela

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es: Ana Daysi J. D. R. resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango del departamento D. San Salvador. Ana se encuentra casada y vive con su esposo e hijo D. 22 años D. edad quien se encuentra trabajando como mecánico en un taller automotriz. Ana ha montado un escenario D. venta en su casa donD. muestra las diferentes blusas y zapatos que venD., Ana solicita este crédito ya que su sueño es poder tener un espacio más organizado donD. sus clientes puedan ver y probarse su ropa cómodamente es por eso que solicita este crédito para poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Daysi J. D. R. lives in the town of Ilopango in the district of San Salvador. She is married and lives with her husband and 22 year old son, who is a mechanic at an auto repair shop. Ana sells different types of blouses and shoes from her home. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Her plan is to have a more organized space where customers can see and try on clothes in a comfortable setting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment into her clothing business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is twenty – seven years old. He is single and has no child. He is a hardworking young man. Paul lives alone in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a fitting mechanic by profession. He repairs faulty vehicles. He has a workshop in his community. He also deals in car spare parts. Paul wants a loan to buy working materials and spare parts to expand his business. He has been in business for three years.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en:
Rodora is 37 years old and is married to Edgar. Their family lives in the village of Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela. They are blessed with six children: Jayford -16 years old, an elementary graduate; Edgar Ralph - 13 years old, a grade V pupil; Altea - 10 years old, now in grade II; Elizear – 9 years old, in grade I; John Paul - 4 years old; and Jain Kim - nine months old. The couple hopes that, through their hard work, they can afford to give their six children the education they need. 

Rodora is a dealer of beauty products in their village. Through her patience and sacrifices in selling her products, she is able to sustain the needs of her family. Her husband is engaged in rice-farming from which they get their major needs.

Rodora would like to obtain a loan of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders. She believes that this amount will help her business to grow.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Altanhuyag

texts.en:
Altanhuyag S. is 42 years old and currently lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His 20-year-old daughter is a 10th grade student in a local high school and his son is an 8th grader in the local school. Altanhuyag sells various dairy products, including cheese, curds, milk, cream, etc. He visits herder families in the countryside, purchases various dairy products at a lower price, and sells them in a small dairy shop that he runs in Uliastai sum, the capital center of Zavhan province. Altanhuyag dreams of having his own farm with livestock one day and opening a shop for his own dairy products. He requests a loan to purchase more dairy products from herder families for his business.

Altanhuyag's wife, who helps him run the dairy shop, is pictured above.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products from herder families for his business

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen M. is 31 years old and happily married to 41-year-old Ariel M. who is a security guard. They have two children. Darlyn Joyce is 10 years old and Precious Zyrene is 2 years old. Only their eldest child is in school. That is why Aireen and her husband Ariel take it as an opportunity to save more for their family until her second child starts school. One source of income is her husband's salary from his work. Although her husband tries hard to earn enough income for them, it is never enough. So to augment her husband's salary, Aireen thinks of a business that will also contribute income for their expenses and allow them to be able to save.

When she joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she wisely used every loan that she received. She always used it to improve her variety store, like today when she will use her loan to buy assorted groceries to sell in her store. She is hoping that her business will always do well.

One dream of Aireen's is that her children finish college. They would do everything just to make this dream possible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her variety store business

loans.name: Gagu

texts.en:
Gagu C. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase other items like cassava and potatoes to sell. Gagu is 60 years old and is married to a peasant. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a new house for the children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase food items for resale

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es: Sonia Esperanza J. D. M. D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Sonia posee una venta D. tortas, las cuales son elaboradas D. carne o jamón y las comercializa sobre la calle principal D. Ilopango. Sonia solicita un préstamo para poder comprar un carretón donD. pueda elaborar y vender las tortas, ya que el que posee es un carretón alquilado. Ella como madre soltera desea mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, ya que es la única fuente D. ingresos con la que cuenta para brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia Esperanza J. D. M. is 38 years old and lives in Ilopango with her three young children, who are all studying. Sonia makes beef and ham sandwiches, which she sells along the main street of Ilopango. Sonia applied for the loan to purchase a cart where she can make and sell her sandwiches. She currently has to rent a cart. As a single mother, she wants to improve her business because it is the only income with which she can proviD. all the necessities to her three small children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a food cart

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline sells fried meat, pepper soup, and drinks.The demands for her drinks are high and she hopes to meet the demands for her drinks during this high season. She is a focused, hard worker.

Caroline is 49 years old and married with five (5) children. Her youngest child is 16 years old. She lives in Delta state, Nigeria. Her husband is a farmer. He is into mixed farming of plantains, pineapple, and cassava. He works hard to also support the home.

Caroline hopes for a loan NGN 100,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy de 42 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus dos hijos Jaime de 12 y Miguel Alfonso de 14 años.Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la costura, trabaja en asociación con unas amigas cosiendo creativos adornos a las blusas que le traen  por cantidad, para que hagan los acabados que en su mayoría son de mostacillas y lentejuelas. A Nancy le gusta mucho su trabajo y es por esta razón  que lo realiza con muchas ganas, aunque muchas veces se le hace rutinario  y algo  difícil  ya que  debe tener muy buena vista y precisión para realizarlo , aún así termina todas las blusas en el plazo estipulado y obtiene buenas ganancias .Es su primer crédito con MFP y promete ser  muy responsable con todos sus pagos.Con el dinero del crédito quiere comprar más cantidad de material para producir mejor los pedidos que le realizan, y así obtener mayores ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 42 years old, and is a very enterprising woman who lives in her own house along with her two sons: Jaime, 12, and Miguel Alfonso, who is 14 years old. For 4 years she has been making clothing; she works in partnership with several friends sewing creative decorations on blouses that they buy in large quantity so that they can do finishes that are mostly made of beads and sequins. Nancy loves her work and for this reason she performs it with great eagerness, although it is often routine and somewhat difficult in that you must have very good vision and accuracy to do it. Still, she finishes all of the shirts on time and earns good profits. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with all of her payments. With the money requested she wants to buy a greater quantity of material so that she can fulfill her orders better and thus obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise to continue with her work

loans.name: Silivia

texts.en:
Silivia K. is 51 and married with 6 children (ages 15 - 28 years).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Silivia has 7 years of experience in this business.  Silivia needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional fish to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 tala or US $104 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Silivia joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Silivia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Silivia K. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.99 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.99 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.89 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.64 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Née le 25 Avril 1962 à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin, Z. Marcelline vit depuis sa naissance au quartier Ayouhangnan à Allada. Mariée à TCHETCHE Ambroise un douanier, Marcelline est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Marcelline n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Marcelline vend des tissus à Ayou à Allada. C'est au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, et à Allada, que Marcelline s'approvisionne. Marcelline a 5 ans d'expérience dans cette activité et a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Marcelline ambitionne élever le niveau de son activité et agrandir sa clientèle ; ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenu à la hauteur de ses charges. C'est la raison pour laquelle Marcelline sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born April 25, 1962 in Allada, in the Department of the Atlantic of Benin, Marcelline Z. has always lived in the Ayouhangnan neighbourhood of Allada. Married to Ambroise TCHETCHE, a customs agent, Marcelline is the mother of three children, all educated. The couple share the household expenses. Marcelline has only attended primary school. To cover her various expenses, Marcelline sells fabrics in the Ayou area of Allada. She gets her supplies from Togo, a country adjacent to Benin, and from Allada. Marcelline has five years experience in this activity, and has already been granted one credit with ALIDé, which has been fully reimbursed. Marcelline’s ambition is to increase the level of her activity and expand her customer base. This will increase her earnings to a level consistent with her expenses. This is why she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 pieces of fabric

loans.name: Petronilla Awuour

texts.en:
Petronilla Awuor O. is married to Johannes Makodia and they have three children. The first born, Collins, will be sitting for his final high school exams at the end of this year. Margaret is the second born and is also in high school, in form three.  The last born, Felistus, will be graduating from primary school at the end of this year.

Petronilla became interested in raising poultry from her mother, who used to do the same business when she was growing up. She has a vast experience of the same from her mother and is doing well rearing the chicken. She hopes to buy some egg-layers, which she will rear for a period of 3 months before they start laying in the fourth month. She is looking for a loan to enable her achieve this. She has taken a loan from Kadet Ltd before, which she successfully completed without any problems, thus giving her a good credit history.

Her clients mainly include the local shops and hotels, which she supplies with eggs and chicken. Her dream is to expand the farm and also introduce broilers to her business.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Petronilla Awuour from  Kenya

loans.use: To buy egg-laying chickens

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn experienced failure as a farmer, but she continues to work hard for her family. Still 23 years old, she said she has a lot to learn about managing a business, especially a rice farm. She sought help from her parents and other farmer friends so she could maintain the farm she tills. She was also able to join an MFI that supports entrepreneurs like her. She applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of 6,000 PHP, which she would use for farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. She said that having this loan is really helpful in running her business.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Lilia's Group

texts.en:
Lilia T. is from the village of Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan Province. She is 48 years old. Lilia is the group leader for a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lilia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products and dressed chicken in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI, and is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Lilia's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha tiene 47 años, es soltera ya que por dedicarse a  cuidar a sus padres que  estaban tan enfermos no se llego a casar vive con un joven de 10 años  que le ayuda en el trabajo a cambio de alimentación y educación, pero la señora Bertha es una persona muy solidaria razón por la cual se adopto una niña recién nacida que fue abandonada en el hospital de una provincia, pues la madre la abandono sin piedad y doña Bertha actualmente la cuida con mucho cariño y responsabilidad.

La señora Bertha vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de maica, en una pequeña casa que le heredo sus padres, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda actualmente cuenta con 6 cabezas de ganado, ya que anteriormente tenía 12 pero tuvo que vender para la mejora de su casa y de esta manera la niña tenga más comodidad.

Es préstamo será desinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, para que de esta manera pueda incrementar su producción de leche.Entre sus sueños y metas es aumentar el nivel de producción de leche para que de esta manera mejore sus ingresos ,y dejarle una buena actividad a la niña y ofrecerle una educación profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha is 47 years old; she is single since she committed herself to take care of her gravely ill parents and never got married; she fosters a 10-year old kid that helps her with the work in exchange of food and an education. Mrs. Bertha is a caring and compassionate person, and she adopted a newborn baby girl that was abandoned in the province’s hospital; the mother abandoned the baby without mercy and Mrs. Bertha is currently taking care of the little girl with much love and dedication. Mrs. Bertha lives in the city of Cochamba, in the town of Maica, in a small house inherited from her parents. Her main activity is the production of raw milk; she now has 6 heads of cattle; she used to have 12 but she had to sell some for house improvements so that the little girl would be more comfortable. The loan will be used to buy one head of dairy cattle so she can increase her milk production. Among her dreams and goals are to further increase her milk production to improve her income, and to leave behind a good business for the little girl and provide her with a professional education.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy one head of dairy cattle

loans.name: Rehema Kashuru

texts.en:
Rehema is 24 years old and single; she resides in Kibaoni-Malindi. She is a tailor by profession and use of this training has been her main source of income. She normally makes designs and sews clothes for a fee and this earns her a monthly profit of Kshs 4,000. Her customers are mainly parents with school going children in the area. 

Rehema was introduced to Kadet by an existing member and this is her first loan. She plans to us the payments from this loan to buy materials/fabric for school uniforms at a price of Kshs 8,000, other more stylish materials for Kshs 5,000, and to pay for transport and miscellaneous expenses with Kshs 2,000. The extra income she anticipates to get from this loan will be used to buy a plot and build her own tailoring shop and rental rooms.

Rehema hopes to see her business grow and she believes she is a hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy fabric for school uniforms and styliish materials, and pay for transport

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: A. Bernadette est née le 31 Décembre 1981 et est mariée à VIHO Bienvenu. Bernadette a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille réside à Sikècodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis deux ans. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Bernadette n'a pas été à l'école, mais a appris la coiffure. Bernadette exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. Parallèlement, Bernadette vend des mèches et des produits de coiffure, et de façon secondaire des tissus dans son atelier de coiffure. Bernadette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Bernadette a déja bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Bernadette désire renforcer son activité et augmenter le stock de ses produits, ce aui lui permettra d'accroître sa part de marché et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pour cette raison que Bernadette sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Bernadette was born on December 31, 1981 and is married to Mr. VIHO Bienvenu.  She has two children, who are both in school.  The family has been residing in Sikècodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for two years.  The couple share in covering the various family expenses. Bernadette did not go to school, but she learned hairstyling.  She has been in this business for about ten years.  At the same time, she sells hair extensions and hair care products, as well as fabrics, in her hair salon.  She purchases her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Lomé, Togo.  Bernadette has benefited already from two loans, which have both been repaid.  She would like to bolster her business and to increase her inventory.  This will enable her to increase her market share and to respond better to customer demand.  For these reasons, she is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair care products (hair extensions, detergents, ointments, etc.)

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y vive solo en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, un distrito próximo a la ciudad de Chiclayo, conocido por su actividad comercial ya que ahí se encuentra el mercado mayorista de la región; también  es conocido por ser el distrito más poblado de la región y por tener altos índices de pobreza, la mayoría de su población se encuentra ubicada en sectores urbano – marginales.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace tres años aproximadamente, el siembra diversos cultivos en un terreno que le arrienda un familiar, actualmente ha sembrado cebolla y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para que pueda obtener una buena producción. El terreno se encuentra ubicado en el caserío Los Aguilares del distrito de Pítipo, esta zona se encuentra a 45 minutos del lugar donde vive.

Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero en la municipalidad del distrito donde vive, esta actividad le provee de ingresos estables con los que solventa sus gastos diarios, ya que la agricultura solo le brinda ingresos en las epocas de cosecha.

Oscar desea brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de cebolla aplicándoles abonos y foliares, para comprar estos  productos y lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Oscar es un hombre bastante trabajador y que gusta mucho de las labores agrícolas, el nos comenta que su mayor sueño es tener un terreno agrícola propio y quedarse a radicar en la zona, además desea incursionar en otras actividades como la ganadería. Sus familiares y conocidos le consideran una persona amable y honrada.
texts.en:
Oscar is 32 years old, single, and lives alone in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, which is located near the city of Chiclayo. The district is known for its commercial activity since the regional wholesale market is located there. In addition, it is known for being the most populous district in the region and for having high rates of poverty. A majority of the population lives in marginalized urban areas.

Oscar has been farming for approximately three years. He plants different crops on land that he rents from a relative. Oscar is currently growing onions and is working hard so that he can achieve good production. The land that he farms is located in the village of Los Aguilares in the district of Pitipo, which is 45 minutes away from where he lives. In addition, Oscar is a municipal employee in the district where he lives. His job provides a stable income to meet his daily expenses since farming only generates income during the harvest season.

Oscar wants to maintain his onion crop by administering compost and plant nutrients. In order to buy these products and achieve his goal, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

Oscar is a man who works hard and enjoys farming. He says his greatest wish is to have his own land where he can settle down and pursue other activities, such as raising livestock. His relatives and acquaintances consider him to be a kind and honest person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & plant nutrients for his onion crop

loans.name: Has

texts.en: Mrs. Has P. is 45 years of age, a widow and the mother of four teenagers who are no longer in school. All four of her children are now employed in different occupations for the purpose of helping to manage the financial crisis of the family. In order to earn a daily income, Has P. owns a cart that she uses to sell roasted meatballs around her community. By doing this, she is able to generate around $3 each day. Presently, Has P. can attract a lot of clients to eat the meatballs as their snacks because she is skilled in public relations. To earn more income and to make her business more successful, Has P. is looking for a loan as the extra capital for her meatball-selling business.

loans.use: To use as extra capital for her business selling meatballs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa J., a widow at 54, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns well so that she and her child can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store and computer shop for the past few years.

Elsa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the success of her business, Elsa would like to apply for a 16,000 Philippine peso loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital to expand her business by buying computer parts needed for the shop. She will use half of the loan to purchase groceries, toiletries and beverages for the variety store. Elsa dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her child’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy computer parts, groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Gabi

texts.es: Gabi, de 35 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Andrés de 34 años y sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar, que es la agricultura, desde entonces cultiva papa, alverja, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Han transcurrido 25 años, y aún disfruta de la siembra, sin embargo el tener que transportar sus productos al mercado mayorista, le ha sido difícil por la escasa movilidad que hay. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su grupo comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gabi, 35 years of age, is a mother and a cheerful worker. She lives in her own home with her husband Andrés, 34 years of age, and her 2 small children for whom she hopes to provide a better quality of life. She learned the family business, farming, when she was still a young girl. Since then, she has cultivated potatoes and peas, work that has provided the necessary income to help support her family. She sells everything she harvests at the wholesale market in Tarma, which is where she can obtain better prices for her product. She still enjoys working the land after 25 years, even though she has to transport her products to the market -- a difficult task, given the scarcity of transportation in the region. Over time, she would like to purchase new lands in order to increase her output. This is her seventh loan with MFP; she has been very timely with repaying her loans, and hopes to be punctual again on this occasion. She is very active in her cooperative, and well liked by the other members in her group. She plans to use the one thousand Peruvian soles she is requesting to purchase more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 54 years old, married with 5 children, and she takes care of two dependents.  Seraphine struggles  to earn the daily food for her children by sewing.  She has been in this business for about 15 years and the hours of her business are from morning until late in the evening hours.

Seraphine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Seraphine plans to expand her business through purchasing 2 additional sewing machines and shift her small business  to another location where she can get more customers.  If successful, Seraphine will keep reinvesting in her business and start saving for a better future.

loans.use: 2 additional sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supplies for making home improvements

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en:
Im N. was selected as the village bank president by the twenty members of this loan group. They live in Tranh village, Kandal province.  Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Im and her husband are medicine sellers and they earn a small profit to support their family. To increase their income to improve their family, Im is asking AMK for a loan to buy more medicines to resell.  The couple doesn't have any children.

loans.use: Buy more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  Sarah has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for a few years, and she works one day every week.  Sarah sells her products from home, by means of retail.  Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through selling sand.  The main business challenge for Sarah is transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot so that she can build rental rooms.  She decided to join MCDT because it was helping poor women to access credit.  Sarah lives in a home that she owns.  She doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina O. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 49 years old. Josefina is married and has 2 children aged 29 and 25. She is in retail business. She sells different products, such as detergent soap, shampoos and supplements. She doesn't have a store yet and only displays her product at the front of her home. She works hard to be able to earn better and to build her store.

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old and he lives with his wife and two children in Virgen Purisima Concepcion in the district of Tucuma. This area exhibits a healthy mix of both rural agricultural activity and commercialization.

Juan raises animals for their subsequent sale at maturity or when they reach the appropriate size. He raises the animals at his home, providing them with balanced feed which he purchases. Juan has been raising animals for the past ten years and has significant experience with a variety of them. His animals are well regarded in the community due to his diligent care and breeding techniques.

This will be Juan’s first loan in the formal financial sector. He plans to use the loan proceeds to expand his herd, purchase additional feed in bulk and make repairs to his corrals. He hopes that these actions will assist him in increasing his family’s income. He dreams of putting his children through school so that they might become professionals. He would also like to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: expand his herd, purchase additional feed in bulk and make repairs to his corrals.

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru: Махмудова Угулой проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 20 лет. Замужем, детей не имеет. Муж на заработках в Росси. Сама Угулой имеет среднее образования. Работает на рынке "Дехкон". Она готовит и продает, блещи, пирожки и печенья. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 3 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Uguloy M. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 20 years old, married and has no children.  Her husband works in Russia.  Uguloy has a secondary education.  She works at the "Dehkon" market.  She prepares and sells pies, piroshki and cookies.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  Uguloy is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela forma parte del banco comunal “Los Conquistadores”  de la comuna de Puente Alto. Ella vende ropa para el hogar usada, como por ejemplo: toallas, cortinas, sábanas y cobertores, en un puesto en la feria, 4 días a la  semana, incluidos todos los fines de semana, desde hace 3 años. Con este préstamo comprará mercadería y también incluirá ropa interior usada. 
Su sueño es tener un local establecido, para así poder atender más días y más horas, ya que además de tener mayores oportunidades de venta, tendría más comodidad, al no tener que llevar y traer cada día su mercadería. Su principal motivación es terminar de ampliar su casa, en donde vive con su esposo. 
Pamela está muy contenta trabajando con Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido un importante aporte para su negocio y para motivarse a seguir creciendo.
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Pamela is part of the communal bank "Los Conquistadores" in the municipality of Puente Alto. For three years, she has sold used household linens, such as towels, curtains, sheets, and blankets, at a market stand four days a week, including weekends. With this loan she will buy merchandise and will also include used undergarments.

Her dream is to have a permanent shop, so that she could be there more days and more hours. Along with having greater opportunities for sales, this would be more convenient, on account of not having to carry her merchandise back and forth every day. Her principal motivation is to eventually enlarge her house, where she lives with her husband.

Pamela is very happy working with Fondo Esperanza, since they have been an important contributor for her business and for motivating her to continue growing. Puente Alto is a municipality located to the north of Santiago, the capital of Chile. It was founded as a small rural town at the end of the nineteenth century, but due to its demographic growth, today it is one of the municipalities with the largest populations in Chile, surpassing 600,000 inhabitants. It is the gateway to Cajón del Maipo, one of the foothills areas of the Metropolitana Region, with hiking trails, cavalcades, and rafting, among other activities, as well as food and lodgings.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Tutu's Group

texts.en:
Tutu A. is the leader of this group. She is 57 years old, married, and has one child who works in construction.  Her husband is a pensioner.  Seven years ago with the initial investment of 500 soms Tutu started to sell convenience goods near her house. She now earns 8,000 soms per month.  That profit made it possible for her to save money to start building her own store.  With money received from the loan Tutu wants to purchase convenience goods such as rice, oil, and macaroni in order to increase the inventory of her business. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Nory Aracely

texts.es:
Nory de 37 años, tiene un taller de costura/confección y vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).  

La mama de Nory le enseño a coser y a confeccionar ropa. Comenzando con una maquina de coser  pudo tener suficientes clientes para solventar sus gastos. Trabaja todos los días en su casa confeccionando pantalones, vestidos, blusas a sus clientes y así tener ingresos suficientes para darle una mejor vida a su hijo de 4 años.

Para poder continuar con su trabajo necesita comprar una maquina y telas para su taller de costura, en el futuro quiere mejorar su taller de costura y darle una buena estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Nory is 37 years old.  She has a dressmaking workshop and lives in las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area which is called 'Orquídeas' - orchids - because when the place was discovered they found many orchids there).  

Nory's mom taught her how to sew and make clothes.  She started with one sewing machine and managed to attract enough customers to cover her expenses.  She works every day in her home making pants, dresses and blouses for her customers so that she has enough income to provide her 4 year-old son with a better life.

To continue with her work, Nory needs to buy a sewing machine and fabric for her sewing workshop.  In the future she would like to improve her dressmaking workshop and provide her family with good financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 31 years old, and married with two children aged three and five. He is a hardworking man who runs a retail shop. His wife assists him in running his business. He started the business two years ago. Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his finances. He hopes to grow his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested 40,000 KES to buy cooking fat, maize, beans and sugar.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, maize, beans and sugar

loans.name: Aura Leticia

texts.es:
doña Aura Leticia V. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el Triunfo choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion.
Aura es una mujer emprendedora, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para hacer sus ricas tortillas y luego salir a  venderlas, ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia.  
sus tiempos libres lo dedican a visitar la iglesia y a sus familiares.
tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal para tener una mayor produccion de tortillas.
texts.en:
Ms. Aura Leticia V. is 45 years old. She lives in Triunfo, Choluteca and makes and sells tortillas. Her business is in her home.  Aura is an entrepreneurial woman; she gets up at 4am to make her delicious tortillas and later go out to sell them. She also has help from her husband who works hard to get the family ahead.

She spends her free time going to church and with her relatives. She also raises and sells chickens and pigs.

She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime to increase her production of tortillas.

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, firewood, water, matches

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es: El Sr .José Daniel labora como fontanero en la sección de corte y conexión  tiene tres hijo es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga ella se siente contenta por la oportunidad brindada ya que con este desembolso lograra comprar materiales de construcción para realizar un anexo en su vivienda.
texts.en: José Daniel works as a Plumber in the cut and connection section.   He has three children and this is his first Ceprodel loan.  He is happy for the opportunity this disbursement provides for he will buy building materials and supplies to add a room to his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvements.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: La Señora Mari Leticia C.: es de 38 años de edad tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que estudian actual mente es casada su esposo trabaja actualmente en la capital, ella tiene 7 años de tener su tienda de consumo diario ella espera creser con este credito que le pueda otorgar FAPE y KIVA ya que desea surtir su tienda con productos comestibles, ella le da gracias a Dios por estas organizaciones que si no fuera por ellos ella no podrilla crecer como emprasaria y estar mejor aconomicamente ya que el dinero no le alcanza solicita este credito para compra de productos comestibles para la venta, espera en Dios poder lograr su objetivo que es que sus hijos sean unos profecionales en el futuro.
texts.en: Mari Leticia C. is 38 years old and has two young children who are in school.  She is married and her husband currently works in the capital.  She has had her store selling items for daily use for seven years.  With this loan granted by FAPE and Kiva, she hopes to grow since she wants to stock her store with food items.  She thanks God for these organizations because if it were not for them, she would not be able to grow as a businesswoman and would not be better off financially as the money is not enough.  She is requesting this loan to buy food items to sell.  She hopes that God will help her achieve her goal for her children to be professionals in the future.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 46 years old and she is married, with four children between 14 and 25 years old. Christine owns a business selling fish. Her business is open from 8am to 6pm. She has an experience of six years in this business and she works every day in the week. Christine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing her business inventory by purchasing more fish to sell. The increased business will help her to earn more profits which will allow her to become stable financially.

loans.use: Purchasing  more fish to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia F. es casada y tiene 2 hijos, los dos en edad escolar.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, de forma ambulante, la misma le genera un buen ingreso.
Con la ayuda de su esposo están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que solicita el crédito de Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, para poder comprar abrigos en cantidad, y venderlos de vuelta a precios más accesibles para sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ganancias para los ingresos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia F. is married and has two children, both school aged.  She’s an itinerant clothing merchant, an occupation that produces good income.  With help from her husband and much sacrifice and dedication they are getting ahead.  Today, she’s a successful micro businesswoman with a large customer base thanks to her good customer service.

She has shown herself to be a responsible and honest person with respect to her commitments so she is asking Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for a loan to buy coats in quantity to resell to her customers at accessible prices thus generating higher profits for her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy coats

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, et  en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Banconi, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali.) 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt  de groupe avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
MAYAMA KADIATOU D. fait le commerce de bois de chauffe dans ce groupe de femmes FOTEMOGOBAN. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 chargements de charrette d’âne en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de la ville de Sikasso.  Elle les revend dans son  quartiers  Banconi,  sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members the FOTEMOGOBAN group are married women who average 36 years of age and four children each. They live mainly in polygamous families in Banconi, a popular neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali.)

This is their seventh group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. All previous loans were correctly repaid.

MAYAMA KADIATOU D. is a member of the FOTEMOGOBAN group who sells firewood. With her loan, she plans to buy five donkey cartloads of firewood. She gets her stock in the villages surrounding Sikasso. She conducts her sales in her neighborhood of Banconi, on order and from her home, for cash, to a clientele composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 27,500 FCFA, which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and to boost her savings.

Her goal is to increase her sales and better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel L. is from the village of Bug-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Rachel is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rachel owns & operates recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes from buying  plastics, bottles, steel bars & other recyclables from local businesses and community members and reselling them. Rachel has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rachel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rachel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Pa

texts.en: Pa C. was born in 1977; she is a married woman and is blessed with four children. Three of them are students at the local public school. Her husband's name is Moun, 41, and he is a domestic farmer in Prey Chor district. She has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. As the pig-raising business is very profitable, she has requested a loan of US$ 1100 to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale when pork is commanding the highest price. With the remainder of the funds, she will support her husband's farming business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets and to support her husband's farming business.

loans.name: Mahougnon 1 Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à une même association d’artisan. La présidente du groupe, Hélène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née en 1976 et est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont les leurs. Hélène et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Hélène n’a jamais été à l’école, mais a appris le métier de couture, une activité qu’elle exerce passionnément et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Hélène achète des plastiques et des chaussures à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, et les revend dans son atelier de couture. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Hélène sollicite pour la première fois un crédit avec les membres de son groupe. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux équiper son salon de couture par une nouvelle machine à surfilage.
texts.en: The “Matignon 1” group is composed of three individuals who are members of the same trade association. The group’s leader, Hélène (raising her hand in the photo) was born on 1976 and married to a man named Albert. The spouses have three children in their care, two  of whom are their own and all of whom are in school. Hélène and her husband live together with their chidlren. Hélène never attended school, but learned the trade of a seamstress. She is passionate about her work, and it also allows her to support herself and her children. As a secondary activity, Hélène buys plastic items and shoes in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, and resells these goods in her shop. With the goal of meeting customer demand, Hélène, together with her group members, is seeking a loan for the first time. This loan will allow her to better equip her sewingshop by adding a new overcastting machine.

loans.use: to buy an overcasting machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: C4372 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Euphrasi is 43 years old and is married with five children between the ages of five and 17. She is the president of a lending group called "Twitezimbere" in the local language. Euphrasi is in a yellow dress on the right and is raising her hand. 

Euphrasi and her team have requested a Kiva loan through the Vision Finance Company. For the past year, Euphrasi has run a butcher shop. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase materials for her shop such as a table, a balance scale, and other items. With the profits from her loan, Euphrasi will save for her family and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her shop such as a table and scale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sonia works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and farming sugarcane. Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. 

Sonia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is married and has been working in the motorbike transport business for the last 16 months. He drives traders, church worshipers, and shoppers to and from the busy Kibuye Market. Having an entrepreneurial mindset, Lawrence wants to expand into a different business. He intends to use his loan to purchase sacks of charcoal that he plans to sell. 

Lawrence hopes to expand his business and be able to support his family. In the future, Lawrence sees himself operating a "Tuk Tuk" (three-wheeled motorcycle transport). He describes himself as innocent, honest, and loving.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal that he plans to sell.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is married and has seven children. She sells cassava, maize and salted fish in Elmina, which she has done for seven years. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband pay the school fees and utility bills. Serah will use this loan to purchase extra quantities of salted fish to sell. She wishes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase extra quantities of salted fish to sell.

loans.name: Saidamad

texts.ru: Саидамад проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его старший сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сам Саидамад имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии проработал два года. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин в центре города, где он продает продукты питания. В этой области он работает уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для покупки колбасных изделий, натуральных соков, муки и приобретения холодильника для торговли мороженного.
texts.en: Saidamad lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 49 years old, married and has five children.  His oldest son works in the Russian Federation.  Saidamad has a higher education as a teacher.  He spent two years working in his profession.  Today, he is involved in retail sales.  He has a store in the center of the city, where he sells food products.  He has been working in this field for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of sausage goods, natural juices, flour and a refrigerator, needed to sell ice-cream.

loans.use: to purchase sausage goods, natural juices, flour and a refrigerator

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 29 years old and married with three school-aged children. She is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Five years ago, Elvie started to engage in a motor transport activity, "habal-habal" (two-wheeled vehicle capable of carrying 2-6 passengers), which is commonly seen in rural mountainous areas. The work gives her a total of PHP 1,500 income a month.

Last year in 2010, she joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from the cooperative. This is Elvie's third loan application with GDMPC. The money is specifically intended to purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts to improve service quality. She hopes to spare a portion of her earnings for maintenance costs and expand the current service offerings.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with one son who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity, and clothing.

For the past six years, Rukia has operated a business selling clothes from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other clothes vendors in the area. She dreams of establishing another shop in the future. With her KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase two bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 26 years old, single, and he has been operating his personal products sales business for the last seven years, making a monthly profit of KES.15,000. This is his fifth loan and he plans to add more stock like mosquito nets, hair extensions, etc. for sale.

With the anticipated profit made he plans to save and diversify into another business. In the near future he hopes to own a "matatu" (public transport vehicle).

loans.use: to add more stock  like mosquito nets, hair extensions, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Msembi

texts.en:
Msembi is a 37-year-old married father of two children. Msembi is a vegetable and fruit vendor in Voi. His business has been in operation for two years and is doing well. 

This marks his second borrowing to finance his business. With this loan Msembi plans to purchase more vegetables and fruits. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business. His dream is to own a wholesale shop and to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Olandina

texts.en:
Olandina is a 51-year-old lady who is married to Olandino, a 63-year-old man. They originated from East Timor. They have two children named: WarteP., 35, who is married and Merita, 18, who is in Senior High School. 

Olandina owns a kiosk business selling daily needs such soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, etc and vegetables such “Kangkung” (water spinach), cauliflower, carrots, spinach and cabbage.
