HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a forty two year old man living in a mud wattle house with five children in Fort Portal Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after seven of his house hold members and his family dream is to have an income generating activity that provides an assured daily income. He is a farmer and deals mainly in cassava. He has been in business for five years and earns tangible profits. Francis needs the loan to buy more cassava  to sell

loans.use: Buying cassava for sale

loans.name: Sel-Mar Group

texts.es: La foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Sagrario,una integrante D. grupo SEL-MAR que está ubicada en el estado de veracruz, en México. En la foto se ve al grupo de señoras alrededor de su mercancía, Sagrario tiene una papelería que inicio hace 3 años,solicita el prestamo para abastecer su negocio con nuevos productos,al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta y satisfecha,tiene 37 años y estudió la preparatoria,es casada y tiene 3 hijos,una mujer y dos varones,quiere este crédito para abastecer su negocio con nueva mercancía,también espera aumentar sus ventas y comprar una copiadora.Selma es la presidenta D. grupo,tiene 22 años,estudió hasta la preparatoria,es soltera y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y calzado que inicio hace 4 años,solicita el prestamo para surtir pedidos, el grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y retomó el nombre de la señora Selma para crear el de SEL- MAR.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Sagrario's home.  Sagrario is a member of the SEL-MAR group which is located in the State of Veracruz, in Mexico.  In the photo you can see the group of ladies surrounding their merchandise.  Sagrario has a stationery store that she set up 3 years ago.  She is requesting a loan so that she can stock her business with new products.  As she requests this loan, she is feeling very happy and satisfied.  She is 37 years old and has her high school certificate.  She is married and has 3 children: one daughter and two sons.  She would like this loan to stock her business with new merchandise.  She also hopes to increase her sales and buy a photocopier.

Selma is the group's president.  She is 22 years old and also has her high school certificate.  She is single and has been selling cosmetics and footwear for four years.  She is requesting a loan to fill her orders.  The group has 10 members and used Selma's name to create the group's name SEL - MAR.

loans.use: To stock her business with new products

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 32 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 11 years old and three adoptees. Her husband is a nurse, and they both work hard to provide all of the basic needs of their family. For the past four years, Jeanne has garnered much experience operating a small business selling telephones. She works from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. everyday, and her business is well-known.

One of the problems she faces is a lack of capital, so Jeanne is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business through the purchase of additional items, thereby enabling her to attract more customers and earn more profit.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La señora Hortencia A. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito.
Esta nuevamente solicitando otro préstamo para comprar más mercancía de mercería. Pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para l inversión es por eso que esta recurriendo a solicitar su cooperación en este préstamo. 
 Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella y su familia puedan tener una vida mas tranquila.
texts.en:
Hortencia A. is grateful for your help by funding her previous loan.

She is now applying for another loan to purchase more haberdashery merchandise, as she does not have the capital she needs to invest in her business. 

This business is the source of income for herself and her family, which allows them to live more peacefully.

loans.use: Investment in her own business.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en:
Natiq B. is a 28-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged sons in Bilasuvar. He is an internally displaced person from the Nagorno-Kharabkh, now living in the small settlement in Bilasuvar built for IDP families.  

In 2004 Natiq opened a fruit and vegetable stand. The best feature of his business is that his stand is in a good location where there is a lot of pedestrian traffic. This is the only source of the income for his family. 

This is his first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He was able to increase the size and variety of his inventory with the help this loan of 2000 AZN. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his children and to increase his product inventory. He will use his profits to cover his needs and repay the loan installments on schedule. 

Natiq wants to expand his business. He plans to open grocery store in the future.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio, tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Braulio nos cuenta que se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte y brinda servicio en la ruta de Cusco, Calca y viceversa. Ya son  varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Braulio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para hacer mantenimiento del carro.    

Braulio pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Braulio is 51 years old and lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. He provides transportation services, namely on the route from Cusco to Calca and return. He has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Braulio currently needs a loan to service his car.

Braulio is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To service his car

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.en:
Eliezer is 30 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 7 years old. He sells maize flour, cassava flour, kilograms of beans, and so on. 

Besides running a shop, Eliezer grows beans, wheat, and sweet potatoes, which are commonly grown in this area.  He employs two people to help him to run these business activities.  

Eliezer has requested  a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to buy more stock for his business because his clientele is growing,  With any additional profit, he will pay school fees for his children and save money for his future.

loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Magaly Isabel

texts.es:
Magaly de 48 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña farmacia ya que  hace tres años atrás trabajo en una farmacia y adquirió experiencia. 

Con dedicación y empeño poco a poco pudo surtir su farmacia. En la actualidad tiene su farmacia surtida con medicinas varias, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.  Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene en la zona donde tiene su farmacia es que en ocasiones se va la energía. Pero quiere seguir trabajando para darles una buena vida a sus hijos de 11 y 8 años. Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas.
texts.en:
Magaly is 48 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who owns a small pharmacy.  Three years ago she worked in a pharmacy and gained experience.  With commitment and determination, she has gradually managed to stock her pharmacy.  It is currently stocked with a variety of medicines.

Magaly works from 6.00am to 10.00pm every day.  One of the problems she faces in the area where her pharmacy is located is that sometimes the electricity cuts off.  However, she would like to continue working in order to provide her children, aged 11 and 8, with a good life.  She would like to use her loan to buy medicines.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur F. is 23 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh Village, an area of Sevan, with his wife and his one-year-old son.
 
For about five years, Artur worked as a waiter in a restaurant. Now Artur and his wife engage in farming. They raise cows, sheep, and chickens. Artur also has been running his own trading business in a coach cabin, where he sells food and beach accessories. Artur has been managing his shop since 2009 and, thanks to trading and farming, he can support his family and was also able to construct a new and more comfortable shop for his trading.
 
Artur is asking for a 500,000-AMD loan to place stall boards and showcases in his new shop and to buy beverages, food, candy, and sausages to resell.

loans.use: to place stall boards and showcases in his new shop and to buy beverages, food, candy, and sausages to resell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita S., 49, a resident of San Andres 2, Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando S., an employee of a private firm, and is the mother of three children. One of their children is in high school, while the other two not yet of school age. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Teresita, as she herself has been a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children. 

Teresita has been in the direct sales business for almost three years now. She sells branded cosmetics, apparel, footwear, household detergents, and other personal products. She allows her customers to order from her based on a product catalog, then orders these items from the company office at a discounted price. Monthly, Teresita earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to buy items ordered in advance by her customers like cosmetics and apparels. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her business. She prays that her business will become successful and aims for financial stability someday. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics and other personal products ordered in advance by her customers

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 42 years old and is married with 3 children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling rice and copra in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan to buy more stock for her business and to buy materials to renovate the warehouse.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear items.

Marivic aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Aurora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aurora, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de gallinas indias, y trabaja de lavar y planchar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para construir una galera con cedazo para tener más segura las gallinas, comprara maya y madera con esto espera mejorar su negocio.
El objetivo  de Aurora  es siempre mantener el negocio y ayudarles a sus hijos que estudien.
texts.en:
Aurora lives with her 2 children and husband.  She dedicates herself to selling chickens, and works doing wash and ironing.  She requests this loan to build a wire fence to keep her chickens more securely.  She will buy mesh and lumber and hopes that, with these supplies, she can improve her business.

Aurora’s goal is to always tend to her business and to help ensure that her children receive educations.

loans.use: buy mesh and lumber to reinforce her farm.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth D. cuarenta años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una panadería en su residencia con la que sostiene a su familia. El pan que venD. Ana es muy conocido en el lugar pues tiene un sabor exquisito siempre está recién hecho y lo venD. a un buen precio además el lugar es muy higiénico. Ana va adelante D. su competencia trabaja desD. muy temprano para estar siempre a la expectativa D. sus clientes no quiere decepcionarlos es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material como harina, azúcar, levadura, agua entre otros. D. esta forma Ana no decepcionara a su clientela y tiene la confianza que podrá sacar adelante a su familia dándoles la seguridad económica que se merecen.
texts.en: Ana Ruth is 40 years old and lives with her husband and children. She runs a bakery out of her home, which is her family's sustenance. The bread that Ana sells is well-known in the area because of its exquisite flavor, it's always freshly baked and sells for a good price, and Ana's bakery is also very clean. Ana gets a head start on the competition working very early and always being on the lookout for customers. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral to allow her to purchase ingredients such as flour, sugar, yeast, water and other items. In this way Ana will not disappoint her customers. She is confident she will be able to make headway for her family, giving them the economic security they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, yeast, water and other ingredients.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours. Her major challenge is competition from other food stall operators. Mwanaidi dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, rice and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, rice and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, she sells at retail and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Escogidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Escogidas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa Adelia de 33 años quien se dedica a la elaboración de cepillos de lavar ropa y cepillo de lustrar desde hace 7 años. Este negocio lo inicio para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos de 13, 10 y 7 años de edad.  
El crédito lo invertirá en materiales estos son; taco, alambre, madera, nailon y pelo etc. y su meta es crecer.
Las otras integrantes son María Alicia de 56 años  e Iris Nubia de 51 años. La señora María trabajaba como doméstica y en su tiempo libre le ayudaba a un familiar que vendía leña, como vio que el negocio era bueno  con unos ahorros compro un caballo, una carreta y contrato un mozo e inicio su negocio.   Iris vende tortillas, cosa de horno y pan de harina, esto lo aprendió de su abuelita y a la edad de 21 años inicio su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Las Escogidas” (The Chosen Ones) group is composed of three hard working, enterprising women.  One of them is Rosa Adelia, 33, who has been manufacturing brushes to wash clothes and polishing brushes for the last 7 years.  She started the business in order to be able to spend more time with her children who are 13, 10 and 7 years of age. She will use the loan to buy raw materials like: handles, wire, wood, nylon, bristles, etc.

The other group members are María Alicia, 56 and Iris Nubia, 51.  María works as a domestic employee and in her free time would help a relative that sells firewood.  Seeing that this is a profitable business she used some savings to buy a horse and a cart, hired a helper, and started her business.  Iris sells tortillas, baked goods and flour bread.  She learned this from her grandmother and started the business when she was 21 years old.

loans.use: to buy brush making supplies.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Fatima has a retail shop that print designs and sells T-shirts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw materials needed for T-shirt printing. Fatima is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Fatima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for T-shirt printing

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Rita has a retail shop where she sells fish, like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell.

Rita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a father of three children, between the ages of 5 and 10. He lives with his family in his native home of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He has been in mixed farming for three years, employing one farmhand and selling his produce of milk, beans and cabbages to the local market. He laments the bad climatic conditions.

Benard has made a loan request of 60,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to educate his children and invest the rest of the income in acquiring better breeds of dairy cows as well as venturing into poultry farming.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando vive con su compañera de vida y su hija la cual asiste a una escuela cercana a la localidad rural donde residen. El posee una venta de panes ambulante, vendiendo en la zona urbana de la localidad en la que vive. Todas las mañanas se desplaza desde su casa junto a su carrito de panes caminando hasta la zona urbana por lo menos treinta minutos y después de llegar va por parques, calles principales, negocios y cualquier otro sitio que concentre clientes, ofreciendo sus ricos panes. Así recoge fondos para sostener su hogar, los panes que comercia son muy solicitados en la zona que visita pues tienen fama de tener un sabor exquisito, los prepara de diferentes formas con salchicha, carne, jamón y pollo, siempre al gusto del cliente, además son a precios realmente accesibles y les ofrece un servicio excepcional; Armando es un hombre dispuesto a cumplir sus sueños con trabajo arduo, él piensa que primero hay que dominar nuestros pensamientos nuestras metas para así poder dominar las circunstancias, de esta forma es como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima como panes, embutidos, carne de res y pollo. Armando tiene confianza en que su esfuerzo será el primer paso para poder darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Armando lives with his life companion and his daughter, who attends school near where they live. 

He works selling sandwiches as a street vendor, selling in the urban area of the community where he lives.  Every morning, he leaves his home with his cart, and walks for at least thirty minutes to the urban area.  There he goes to the parks, the main streets, businesses, and some other sites where customers are concentrated, offering his delicious sandwiches for sale.  In this way he earns money to keep up his household.  The sandwiches that he sells are much requested in the area he visits, as they are famous for their exquisite taste.  He makes different kinds, with sausage, beef, ham, and chicken.  They are always to the taste of the customers, and are also really affordable, plus he provides exceptional service.

Armando is a man who is inclined to achieve his dreams through hard work.  He thinks that first you must master your thoughts and your goals, to be able to master your circumstances.  This is why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow him to buy raw ingredients such as bread, sausage, beef, and chicken.

Armando has confidence that his effort will be the first step in providing his family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy bread, sausage, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Colletar

texts.en:
Colletar is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past nine months, she has operated a cosmetic shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to expand her business to a wholesale shop. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase cosmetics and bundles of clothes for another business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and bundles of clothes for another business.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Ganchimeg is 37 years old and lives with her five children and husband in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter is a college student and another three are high school students. She started her business in 2001 by making and selling Mongolian traditional shoes at her home. She has already gained recognition from her clients and customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "Our family has a college student. I want to pay the tuition fee to the university. Also I have a plan to expand my business and open a factory." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy materials to make shoes.

loans.use: To buy materials to make shoes

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 38-year-old married woman with six children. She used her previous loan to buy a taxi and educate her children. However, she is facing the challenge of increasing fuel prices which are decreasing the income from her taxi business. 

Irene is requesting another loan to buy sugar, soap, and beans to sell at the retail shop that she owns. She wants to boost sales at her shop because it has lower operational costs.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, and beans to sell

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista de 61 años, desde hace 6 años aproximadamente se ha dedicado a su pulpería en donde ofrece leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas, frutas y bebidas. Su negocio lo tiene establecido en su viven en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llega a comprar la variedad de productos que ofrece ha solicitado un crédito para comprar más mercaderías comestibles, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Juan Bautista, 61, has been running his grocery store for about six years.  He stocks milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, snacks, fruit and soft-drinks.  His store is located in his home where most of his customers come by to buy the variety of products he offers.  He has requested a loan to buy more groceries.  His only goal is that the business grow and to have more products available for his customers.

loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Saline

texts.en:
Saline is 31 years old.  She is married to Benson and together they have three children, aged 13, 10 and 3.  She is a tailor and has been in this business for the past two years.  She gets a monthly income of KES 3,000 from the business.

This is Saline's first loan from KADET LTD.  She will use the loan amount to buy more clothes.  She will use the profits to educate her children.  She hopes to purchase a piece of land and set up residential houses.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Arturo sigue trabajando brindando servicio de transportes de mudanza en su propio camión. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Arturo requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro y para la construcción de su casa. 
 
Arturo se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Arturo participates in the “Ricchary  Runa” communal bank with Asociación  Arariwa, in the city of Cusco.  Currently Arturo is working providing moving services with his own truck.  He has been working in this business for several years, and it has been going very well for him.

Arturo is requesting the loan to conduct maintenance on his vehicle and for construction for his home.

Arturo is grateful for the opportunity being provided to him by this means, and also commits to comply with the scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to conduct maintenance on his vehicle and do some construction on his home.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica, una joven madre de 24 años, convive junto a Gabriel de 26 años, viven en su casa propia junto a su bebita quien es el motivo de alegría y a quien desea brindarle un buen futuro. Yessica, tiene una pequeña sastrería donde sus clientes llevan su ropa con mucha confianza ya que sus deberes de coser ropa son muy buenos. La gente no duda en el trabajo que realiza, porque se los entrega muy puntual y bien hechos. Lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad, lo cual le gusta su trabajo porque puede estar constantemente con su bebita para ella no hay nada difícil ya que lo único que desea es brindarle un mejor futuro a su pequeña. Con el crédito solicitado podrá comprar una maquina de coser y seguir trabajando constantemente para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su préstamo número 03 con MFP, por tanto agradece a los financistas por la colaboración que le brindan para seguir cumpliendo con su trabajo. Asimismo le grada ser parte de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar una maquina de coser para seguir trabajando y dar buenos resultados con su trabajo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yessica is a young mother, aged 24.  She lives with Gabriel, aged 26, in their own home together with their young daugther who is their source of joy and for whom she wants to provide a good future.

Yessica has a small tailoring workshop where her customers get their clothes with great confidence as her skills in sewing clothes are very high.  People have no doubts about her work, because she delivers clothes that are punctual and well-made.  She has been doing this work for three years.  

What she likes about her work is that she can be constantly with her young daughter. There's nothing difficult for her about her work, as the only thing she wants is to provide a better future for her little one.

With the requested loan, she will be able to purchase a sewing machine and continue working steadily to have a better quality of life.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She is very grateful to the lenders for their collaboration in her ongoing work.  She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank, as all the members are very responsible people.

With the 1,000 new soles, she will be able to purchase a sewing machine so that she can continue working and give her customers good results with her work.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Worood

texts.en:
Worood is a 31-year-old single lady who lives with her parents. She works in a company that is located in one the Jordanian universities.

Three years ago she bought a few sheep and goats for her mother Nawal (who appears in the photo) to get milk to make yogurt out of for sale. Now Worood wants to increase the number of goats that she has to increase their productivity as there is more demand for the products her mom makes, and that’s why she has applied for this loan.

Because Worood is a conservative person, she asked her mother Nawal to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Tlang

texts.en:
Tlang is 31 years old and a loving father of two children, living in the Baray district. 

He is a rice cultivator and also acts as a motor mechanic in his commune. He is able to generate an income of approximately $5 per day through his businesses. 

Tlang’s wife always helps him in earning income by raising pigs. They are very hard-working because they want to place their children in good universities after they finish high school. 

At the present, Tlang is applying for a loan from HKL to purchase two pieces of farmland to increase his rice production next year. He is very thankful for the support in his business. He hopes that this loan will change his living conditions as he strives to work.

loans.use: to purchase two pieces of farmland.

loans.name: Rouwatou

texts.fr:
Rouwatou est une femme  âgé(e) de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un  électricien bâtiment. Elle a 03 enfants dont un à l'école. L'ainé a 15ans et le dernier 09ans.
Rouwatou travaille comme revendeuse de produits de mercerie depuis 2006. Elle vend  à ses clients dans une boutique. Rouwatou a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de mercerie. Elle veut économiser pour vendre des pagnes.
Dans les prochaines années, Rouwatou voudrait agrandir l’activité.  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Rouwatou is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to a building electrician. She has three children of whom one goes to school. The eldest is 15 and the youngest 9 years old.

Rouwatou has been working as a reseller of notions since 2006. She sells to her clients in a shop. Rouwatou has requested her third loan from WAGES in oder to buy notions. She wants to save in order to sell loincloths.

In the coming years, Rouwatou would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family's vital needs.

loans.use: to buy notions.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Равшану 29 лет у него 2 дочери,  он имеет высшее образование. Разводит скот в течении 14 лет. Он утром отправляет скот на пастбище и вечером пастухи отгоняют скот обратно. С нашей организацией  начал сотрудничать недавно. Планирует увеличить своё поголовье скота. По совету отца он купит несколько голов коз и овец и до весны будет разводить их. Благодарен за поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en: Ravshan is 29 years old and has 2 daughters. Ravshan has higher education. He has been breeding livestock for 14 years. He takes his livestock out to pasture in the morning, and shepherds bring them home in the evening. Ravshan has recently started collaborating with our organization. He is planning on increasing the livestock numbers. As his father advised him, Ravshan will purchase a few head of goats and sheep and raise them till spring. Ravshan thanks KIVA for the support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa is 59 years old.  She is married and has seven children.

Sa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro to sell.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Sa is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST or $188 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Sa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sa's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Nkubu, is married, and has three children. She has been a farmer for over twenty years, dealing mostly with cereals.
Jane has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.20,000 to purchase rabbits. This will increase her level of income and hence improve her family's living standards. In the future she wants to have a pick-up of her own. Her major challenges are crop pests and diseases, and insufficient funds.
She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for improving her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase rabbits

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles used the previous loan to buy pesticides and pay workers who work in his gardens.

Charles has managed to maintain his agriculture business even though his area is still affected by pests and diseases, floods, and price fluctuations of agricultural products. 

He dreams of having a healthy family and educated children. Charles needs the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Getrede's Group

texts.en:
Getrede is a 51-year-old proud mother of 12 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and represents her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Getrede has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Getrede described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to purchase a solar light, as well as fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Getrede’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Barrio San Antonio Group

texts.en:
The people of Santa María Visitación have very rich cultural traditions that make them very proud; the colorful dress of the women is ornate and beautiful. It consists of a woven and embroidered rectangular blouse called a “huipil” (wee-peel), wrap around woven skirt or “corte” and an embroidered and woven belt called a “faja”. The predominant languages are the indigenous language of K’iché and Spanish. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Barrio San Antonio” is located here and is composed of seven entrepreneurial women. Julia, who is a member of the Trust Bank, is 42 years old and has been married for 20 years; she has five children who range in age from 7-18. Julia is working hard so that each of her children can have formal education since she realizes how important it is. She was only able to study until the 6th grade. She is empowered, motivated and appreciates her loan that she is going to use in her beekeeping and textile businesses. She raises bees, as well as embroiders and weaves the traditional “huipiles” of her town. Julia also distributes natural medicines to sick children in her area. She is requesting a loan to buy a number of supplies for her textile business including thread, wool, silk, and other needed supplies. She wants to have plenty of raw materials for her textile treasures, especially at this time of the year. Julia has utilized part of her income to purchase a plot of land, repair and expand her home, buy a computer and most importantly, send her children to school.
 
The ladies look forward to their monthly meetings when they have the opportunity to socialize, make payments on their loans and participate in educational trainings conducted by a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge. A specific topic is covered at each meeting and the Facilitator uses games, role playing, pictures and diagrams to share the information. Most of the women have had little or no formal education. 

Julia is especially grateful to be a member of the Trust Bank since she is the sole provider for her children. Several years ago, her husband became ill and was unable to work.  She had to assume a leadership role in their home. 

Thank you, KIVA investors, for believing that Julia and her friends in the Trust Bank have the capacity to progress and create more prosperous lives for themselves, their families and their community!

loans.use: To buy supplies for her textile business including thread, wool, silk, and other needed supplies

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
Rai is a villager of Stoeng Sen district where crop farming is the common way to earn a living. Rai is 38 and married with children. Like other villager, Rai has been struggled to make a living by farming rice and sometimes working as a paid worker to earn additional income. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 10$ per day, but she manage to save about 5$ each day. 

Rai has never been with VisionFund before, now she is asking for a loan to buy solar panel for lighting in her house. She hopes that this loan will enable her to reduce on electric bill.

loans.use: to buy solar panel for lighting in her house

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Cesar Hugo

texts.en: Cesar Hugo is a 58 year old blacksmith who specializes in the production of metal doors, window frames and fences. These products are in high in demand in poor sectors in order to protect businesses and homes from robbery. Cesar has 4 sons who work with him on his business which is operated out of his mother’s home. Currently he can only work when he receives an order because he does not have the money to buy materials so that he can make products in advance. He hopes that this loan will allow him to make some doors and gates he can display in order to attract more clients and sell at faster rates.

loans.use: Purchase Materials

loans.name: Angèle

texts.en:
Born May 20th, 1977 in Dapaong, Mrs. Angèle D. is a married mother of three children. She has been stocking and selling corn for seven years. She had to follow her husband, who is a teacher, when he was recently relocated to Attitogon. Fortunately, she is managing to re-establish her business, though she would like to strenghten it to assert herself in her new location. During her current phase of stocking, she is seeking a $750 loan to take advantage of opportunities for puchase and storage of grains. Her business success will allow her to help her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 20 Mai 1977 à Dapaong, Madame D. Angèle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité le stockage et la vente de maïs depuis 7 ans. Son mari enseignant affecté à Attitogon, elle se trouva dans l’obligation de le suivre. Heureusement elle arrive à se retrouver mais cherche à renforcer son activité afin de pouvoir s’imposer dans son nouvel environnement. A cette période de stockage de céréales, elle sollicite un apport financier de $750 pour saisir des opportunités d’achats et stockage de céréales .La réussite de ses activités lui permettra d’aider son mari à supporter les dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase and stocking of grains

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: KK, as she is called, has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She makes beadwork for the local and foreign market. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es:
Isabela is 30 years old and is married with 6 children. She makes skirts, shirts and patterned trousers and she sells them in the ‘Santo Domingo’ market alongside the established salesmen and women and therefore she does not earn much. She is a part of the group ‘Arcos 4’ in which all of the members work in the same trade. They are: Rebeca Santiz L. and Andrea Gomez Jimenez. With the loan they hope to buy different coloured thread and large quantities of material and therefore produce more garments.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

ISABELA TIENE 30 AÑOS , CASADA SEIS HIJOS , ELLA SE DEDICA A HACER FALDAS , BLUSAS , PANTALONES DE MANTA BORDADOS Y LOS VENDE EN EL MERCADO DE SANTO DOMINGO CON LOS COMERCIANTES QUE YA TIENEN LOCALES ESTABLECIDOS LO QUE IMPLICA QUE SUS GANANCIAS SEAN LAS MINIMAS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ARCOS 4 DONDE TODAS SUS INTEGRANTES LABORAN HACIENDO LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD . Y ELLAS SON : REBECA SANTIZ L. Y ANDREA GOMEZ JIMENEZ CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN COMPRAR HILOS DE DIFERENTES COLORES Y MANTA POR GRANDES CANTIDADES Y ASI AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION.

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIA

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the fifteen women of the Farlu Liguey association, led by Ms. Seynabou T.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“In spite of the countless social difficulties that arise from the disastrous economic situation, the village of Diourbel has kept alive its ancient tradition of producing tourgui ndiareme textiles. Although the women of Diourbel have been severely affected by the economic hardship, they jealously guard the secrets of weaving these small wrap outfits, which are highly prized by both locals and outsiders. With the recent acceleration in migration out of rural areas, women occupy a strategic position in the area of clothing production and other crafts. These products are easily marketed thanks to the numerous loumas (weekly markets) and Diourbel's proximity to the holy city of Touba, which attracts enormous crowds in its seasonal pilgrimages. This has been a boon to the women who supplement their families' incomes with local trading activities. In order to strengthen these activities, the members of our group always need to augment their available stock so that they can ensure continuous and diversified production. Since many women compete in this market, the members of our group also plan to introduce the sale of finished products purchased in other loumas.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«DIOURBEL malgré les multiples problèmes sociaux liés à la situation économique désastreuse a gardé une veille tradition dans le domaine du textile et de la confection (tourgui ndiarème). Les femmes mêmes très touchées par ce contexte, gardent encore jalousement les secrets du tissage des petits pagnes, bien prisés par les citadins et autres étrangers. Avec le phénomène de l’exode rural les femmes occupent une position stratégique dans le domaine de la confection du linge de corps, habits et produits artisanaux. Grâce aux nombreux loumas (marché hebdomadaires) les produits trouvent un circuit d’écoulement avec la proximité de la grande ville sainte (TOUBA) qui draine pour chaque occasion du monde fou dans la région. Pour le petit commerce comme un peu partout c’est devenu une pratique courante et très lucrative pour de nombreuses femmes du BAOL Pour renforcer les activités les membres ont toujours besoin de stock disponible pour une confection continue et diversifiées des produits. Actuellement beaucoup de femmes se dispute le marché c’est pourquoi les membres veulent développer la vente des produits finis achetés dans les autres loumas»

loans.use: Purchase of thread, needles, and cloth for  traditional garment production; purchase of finished goods and transportation for long-distance trade

loans.name: Ssekandi

texts.en:
Ssekandi is a 25-year-old married man with three children: two girls aged 4 and 7 and one boy of two and half years. He also supports one sister, aged 17, who is attending secondary school. He is a motorcycle mechanic with experience of over three years. He is renting a small stall in the suburbs of Kampala, where he repairs and sells spare parts.

He would like to borrow $1,200 to expand his business by purchasing spare motorcycle parts. This will increase his revenue base, which will enable him to fulfill his plan of acquiring a workshop with a welding machine, charging machine, grinder, and generator.

loans.use: To purchase spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a seller of children's clothes. She has 12 years of experince in this line of business at the market. Her business stall is located in Istaravshan's clothing market, in Khujand. Her business is developing more every month and she receives a good profit from it.

Matluba spends her loans expanding her inventory and tries to have goods of high quality. She also wants to include jeans in her assortment of goods. She saysthat jeans are always in good demand.

Matluba wants to purchase the next batch of goods for the winter season and is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1000.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing for resale

loans.name: Angela Del Rosario

texts.es:
Angel's activity is the purchase and sale of crafts in the city of Leon, Nicaragua. In order to sell crafts, Mrs. Lopez travels to the city of Masaya where she buys the products and later pays to transport them to Leon, where she has a small space from where she sells.

She started her business 30 years ago with her savings and an inheritance from her grandmother.

Her business began in Masaya, and later she moved to Leon, situating herself in the area around the main cathedral of Leon, spreading out her products on the ground. Later on she found a place in the central park. Before she had her own business, she helped her grandmother in the same type of work.

Angela is a single mother, and she stands out because of her efforts to prepare her 2 children for the future.

For the past two years she has received financial help from Ceprodel, which has been her helping hand with 13 loans. These have had an impact by allowing her to improve the appearance of her business and the conditions in which she lives, since the maintenance of her family and their education and health depend on the profits of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Ángela L. es a la compra y venta de artesanías en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Para poder realizar esta venta de artesanías como toda dama esforzada la sra. L. viaja hacia la ciudad de Masaya donde adquiere estos productos y posteriormente paga transporte para trasladar dichos productos a León que es donde los vende en un estante o espacio para colocarlos.

Inició su negocio hace 30 años con un monto que fue producto de ahorro y herencia de su abuela.

Su negocio comenzó en un tramo en Masaya y luego emigró a León ubicándose en la acera de la Catedral de la misma ciudad colocando sus productos en el suelo, luego consiguió un lugar en el parque central. Antes de tener este negocio le ayudaba a su abuela en este tipo de negocio hasta que se independizo.

La sra. Ángela L. es madre soltera, y se destaca por ser muy esforzada ya que tiene 2 hijos que los esta preparando para su futuro.

Recibió desde hace dos años ayuda financiera por parte de Ceprodel el cual ha sido su mano amiga con 13 créditos que le han impactado en haber mejorado la apariencia de su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que de sus utilidades ha dependido el sustento diario de su familia, educación y buena salud de los mismos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Yawo Mawuéna

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawo Mawuéna A., 26, is married and the breadwinner for four persons. His primary business activity is selling gasoline. This is where most of his income comes from. Known by his customers for his patience and reasonableness, he purchases gasoline at a service station and comes back to sell it by the liter in his village. Since he lacks the financial means to expand his business, he is seeking a loan in the amount of US$ 300 so that he will be able to buy a larger quantity of gasoline. The increased income will allow him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 26, monsieur A. Yawo Mawuéna est marié et compte à sa charge quatre (04) personnes. La vente du pétrole est son activité principale. C’est d’ailleurs de cette activité qu’il tire plus de revenus. Reconnu par ses clients pour sa patience et sa clémence, il achète le pétrole à la station d’essence et revient le vendre en détail dans son village. Aujourd’hui, faute de moyens, il sollicite un apport financier de $300 afin d’acheter en grande quantité le pétrole. Le revenu lui servira de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase and re-sale of gasoline

Achat et vente de pétrole

loans.name: Liane

texts.en:
Liane O. is a single woman who lives in her mother’s house, which is where the business is operated. More specifically, Liane’s mother is a nurse, and they run a small pharmacy out of the home. Although the business has experienced a great deal of success, Liane would like to see it continue to grow.  

Liane is currently attending night school, so she works with her mother during the day.  Liane and her mother have used their dynamic business skills and intelligence to create a viable and profitable business.  The loan they are seeking would be used to purchase additional medicines, which should increase their profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase additional medicines.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Tính, 28 year old, is a young, hardworking woman and a entrepreneur. Because of that, she and her husband is better off than other same age couples. They moved from rice farming to butchering pork and beef to deliver to meat stands. The family’s economy is much better and the two small children are also taken care better since the move. The monthly income is 180-200USD. She is applying for a loan of 825USD to invest in there butchering business. She is a 3rd year member of the TYM Fund.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Tuổi còn trẻ nhưng nhờ chịu thương chịu khó biết tính toán làm ăn nên cuộc sống gia đình chị Phạm Thị Tính, 28 tuổi, ổn định hơn so với các đôi vợ chồng trẻ khác. Nếu trước đây chỉ nhìn vào thu nhập từ nông nghiệp, mức thu thấp thì từ khi tham gia Quỹ chị Tính có thêm nguồn thu khá ổn định từ buôn bán. Nắm bắt thị trường giá cả tăng lên chị cùng chồng chuyển sang nghề buôn và giết mổ lợn, bò nhập cho các cửa hàng. Từ nguồn thu này kinh tế gia đình đã tăng lên rõ rệt, hai con chị được chăm lo đầy đủ hơn. Thu nhập hàng tháng của hai vợ chồng là 180-200USD. Vòng vốn này chị Tính tiếp tục xin vay 825USD mua bò lợn về mổ thịt bán. Chị hiện đang là thành viên năm thứ 3 Quỹ Tình thương.

loans.use: Buy bulk meat for the butchering business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Ruth L.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 9 and 22. She also has two dependents, her brother's children, who live with her.

In 1987, Ruth established her butcher shop. Ruth requires a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle, which she will use to pick up supplies and deliver produce to customers. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to pick up supplies and make deliveries to customers.

loans.name: Theong

texts.en: Theong L. is a rice farmer in Kampong Cham. She carries on the traditional subsistence farming existence that her people have lived in for thousands of years. She herself has farmed since 1979, the year the Khmer Rouge regime lost power. She earns $1 per day, sometimes less. Her husband earns similar wages as a yam farmer and part-time fisherman. He is much newer to farming than she is, only having been involved since the year 2000. The two of them have had six children together and have seen four of these children grow up and be married! Two of their children moved to Phnom Penh where they knew they could earn better wages than in Kampong Cham. One is working construction while the other is in a local garment factory. Both send some funds home to help support the family. Theong L.’s loan funds will go towards expanding her husband’s yam farming operation in their home province. They will buy an additional plot of farmland as well as yam seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farmland and yam seeds.

loans.name: Jerobia

texts.es:
Jerobia is small business owner who sells clothes and cosmetics. She also does sewing jobs at the same time. She started her business 8 years ago and would like to increase her customer base and also improve the merchandise that she offers.

Jerobia is 45 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of Managua. She's married and her husband is self-employed as an electrician. She has 4 children - 3 of them school-aged and the oldest son lives on his own.

Her greatest goal is to be able to provide an education to her three sons so that the family can continue to get ahead and improve their standard of living and also so they can develop into good men and good members of society.

The loan that she is asking for will be used to purchase construction materials to begin construction on a porch for her home and to be able to provide her family better security and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Jerobia es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos a la misma vez que realiza trabajos de costura, desde hace 8 años inició este negocio del que espera poder aumentar su clientela y mejorar también la oferta que ofrece. Doña Jerobia tiene 45 años, habita en el barrio Villa reconciliación de Managua, es casada, su esposo es electricista y trabaja por cuenta propia. Tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos están en edad escolar y su hijo mayor es independiente a ella. Su mayor meta es poder darle educación a sus tres hijos para que cómo familia puedan salir adelante, y ellos mismos puedan desarrollarse como hombes de bien para la sociedad. El préstamo lo está solicitando para compra de materiales de construcción para empezar a construir el porche de su casa de habitación y poder darle a su familia mayor seguridad y mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a porch for her home.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro is the father of 8 children. They help him with the agriculture activities and are the motor that keeps him working hard for their future. He works fast to achieve quality products. The high prices of fertilizer have caused his production to slow down, he wishes to do better, have more production and increase the number of hectares with crops. To do it, he needs capital, which he requests through a loan and hopes that you can help him, this way he can look forward to a profitable production to increase his income and pay for his children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Mauro es padre D. 8 hijos quienes son su ayuda en sus actividades dentro D. L. agricultura y su motor para trabajar arduamente por su futuro, el trabaja a un ritmo acelerado para obtener productos D. calidad. Pero por los altos costos D. los abonos y fertilizantes ha disminuido su producción, L. cual desea mejorar, cultivar en mayor cantidad y ampliar sus hectáreas D. cultivos.Para ello requiere D. una inversión, dinero que solicita como préstamo y espera que usted pueda ayudar a conseguirlo, así poder tener L. esperanza D. que su producción y cosecha sean rentables para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y cubrir L. educación D. sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Husnigul

texts.ru: Саидджонова Хуснигуль хочет получить кредит для своего бизнеса . Она занимается торговлей овощами. Опыт работы в данной сфере 14 лет . Привозит товар на центральные рынки Явана , скупая их у  дехкан. Ей 48 лет , она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Ее бизнес –это основной источник дохода ее семьи. Поэтому она хочет развивать торговлю и расширять бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Husnigul S. would like to take out a loan for her business. She sells vegetables. For the last 14 years, she brings goods which she has purchased directly from the farmers to the central market in Yavan. She is 48 years old, married and has six children. Her business is the main source of income for her family, and therefore she wants to expand her business. She plans to repay her loan over the course of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Odilboy

texts.en: R. Odilboy is 22 years old. He lives in Isfara with his parents. Despite his young age, Odilboy has already become the main bread-winner in his family. Odilboy is a dynamic and ambitious young man who is very professional and focused on his business. He has a business selling cement at the building materials market. He has been in this business for 5 years and has gained a rich variety of experiences. He has a special warehouse where he safely keeps his goods. He knows how to save cement so that it doesn’t deteriorate. All this allows Odilboy to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for the family. With money from his business he is also able to pay for his university fees. Today, knowing that the price of the cement is low but will increase soon, he wants to purchase more goods. For this reason, he is asking a loan of $750 for the term of 6 months. He wants to use the money that he earns from his business to pay for his wedding. Odilboy expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing cement

loans.name: Armenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La microempresaria Armenia del Socorro Pérez Montalván tiene 48 años de edad es casada con dos hijos que estudian en primaria y secundaria en esta ciudad de Bluefields. Esta microempresaria tiene desde hace 15 años  una pulpería la cual ha ido surtiendo poco a poco y la que le sirve para sufragar parte de los gastos de estudios y alimentación de la casa. Habita en uno de los barrios más viejo de esta ciudad llamado Nueva York. La microempresaria manifiesta que uno de los productos que mas se venden es el carbón el cual se utiliza para como combustible para la preparación de los alimentos.

También los titiles de pollo ya que son un poco mas barato que el pollo mismo y otro producto que es muy comprado es el coco el cual se utiliza para darle sabor a las comidas típicas de la región.

Sin embargo requiere se le financie para comprar lo siguiente: 

2 Quintales de arroz americano a US$ 48 dólares cada quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a US$ 33 dólares cada quintal, 2 bidón de aceite a US$ 35 dólares cada bidón, 50 libras de pollo entero a US$ 1.90 dólares cada libra, 50 libras de titil de pollo a US$ 1.20 dólares cada libra, 5 cajillas de huevos a US$ 3.00 dólares cada cajilla, 6 bolsones de papel higiénicos a US$ 8.00 dólares cada bolsón, 20 sacos de carbón a US$ 10.00 dólares cada saco, 50 unidades de cocos a US$ 1.20 dólares cada coco,  y  100 plátanos a US$ 0.40 dólares cada plátano.
texts.en:
Armenia del Socorro Pérez Montalván, a small business owner, is a 48-year-old married mother of two school age children in the city of Bluefields. This small business owner has run a general store for 15 years. She has been stocking the store little by little, and it helps her defray some of the costs of education and of food for the household. She lives in one of the oldest neighborhoods in the city, called Nueva York. The small business owner says that one of her most popular products is charcoal, which is used in preparing meals. Other popular items are chicken gizzards—since they are cheaper than chicken itself—and coconuts, which are used to add flavor to the regional dishes. Nevertheless, she needs funds in order to purchase the following: two 100-pound sacks of American rice at $48.00 USD each, two 100-pound sacks of sugar at $33.00 USD each, 2 drums of cooking oil at $35.00 USD each, 50 pounds of whole chicken at $1.90 USD a pound, 50 pounds of chicken gizzards at $1.20 USD a pound, 5 boxes of eggs at $3.00 USD each, 6 large packs of bathroom tissue at $8.00 USD each, 20 sacks of charcoal at $10.00 USD each, 50 coconuts at $1.20 USD each, and 100 bananas at 40 cents each.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, chicken gizzards, eggs, bathroom tissue, charcoal, coconuts and bananas

loans.name: Aissa

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Aissa K. from Mwanza, a beautiful city on the shores of Lake Victoria.(Lake Victoria is famous not only for being one of the largest lakes in the world, but also because it feeds the Nile River, a very important source of life for Africa.) Aissa is married and has 4 children between the ages of 15 and 24. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents who were orphaned when their parents passed away due to HIV/AIDS.

Aissa is quite the entrepreneur--she has been running both her general store and her hair salon since 2006. At her general store, she sells an assortment of items from vitenge (traditional Tanzania cloth) to detergent to beauty products. At her salon, she offers a wide variety of services from haircuts to weaves. She works at her two businesses 9-12 hours a day and is assisted by her husband and children. Aissa currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to expand both of her businesses. Aissa thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store and hair salon

loans.name: Mumtaz Barkat Ali Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji is a 41 year old married woman and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband, B. A., is a painter by profession and sells paints as well. Mumtaz baji is the mother of three sons. For the past 20 years, Mumtaz baji has been a seamstress and sews clothes by taking orders from her neighborhood. She is is requesting a loan to buy paint brushes and paints to expand her family business.

She is a group leader of a few more members of her locality. Majeedan baji is requesting a loan to buy wheels for vehicles to resell. Nasreen baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Parveen baji is requesting a loan to pay the installments of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Hamidan baji is requesting a loan to buy repairing tools for her mobile phone repairing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy paint brushes and paints.

loans.name: Husina

texts.en: Husina H. is a Tanzanian woman who owns a water well at Vituka in Dar Es Salaam. She supplies water to customers for domestic use purposes in Vituka. People in Dar Es Salaam have limited access to water, so businesses like Husina's are very important. Husina wants to increase water supplies for her customers by drilling more wells. She is requesting  a loan of  Tsh. 600,000.

loans.use: To expand business (drill a new well)

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin is 42 years old. She is married with 4 children.

Toyin has a unique business. She sells blocks of ice in the market. She has two deep freezers that can carry 75 pieces of ice blocks each.

Toyin is a client of LAPO. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase another deep freezer so she can increase the number of ice blocks she can sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a third deep freezer

loans.name: Nakhida

texts.en: Nakhida A. is a 40-year-old married woman with one son. She has been involved in the cattle breeding ever since she got married. She likes look after the calves and does it with a great pleasure because this business is the main financial source for her family. Since she is a housewife, she enjoys having her own business and would like to expand her business via purchasing two more calves. For this purpose she applied for $1200.

loans.use: Purchase two calves.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.fr:
G. Prisca est née vers 1988 à Dja  dans la commune de Sèmè kpodji. Prisca est célibataire sans enfants. Prisca mène comme activité la vente des produits vivriers tels que le maïs, le haricot, la farine de manioc localement appelée gari et le charbon de bois. Prisca va s’approvisionner souvent à Tokpa, le marché international du Bénin.Prisca a pour clientèle les habitants de son quartier Avotrou  de Cotonou.Prisca est à son quatrième crédit et souhaite avoir celui-ci pour renforcer son activité.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
G. Prisca was born around 1988 in Dja, in the community of Sèmè Kpodji. She is unmarried and has no children. Her work involves selling staple foods, such as corn, beans, cassava flour (locally called gari), and charcoal. She is going to supply herself often in Tokpa, the international market of Bénin.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sacks of charcoal, a sack of corn, and a sack of beans

loans.name: Mah Jan Group

texts.en:
Mah Jan is the group leader of the Mah Jan group. There are two members. Each of them wants to take a loan to expand their businesses.

Mah is a carpet weaver who wants to buy materials. Sediqa's loan will help her son’s business, a fuel selling shop. They request a group loan of 21000 Afghani for the term of 8 months. They want to say that Kiva is the best process.

loans.use: Expand business opportunities.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
For ten years, Abena W. has been a trader selling food items like peanuts and beans in Siwdo. She buys them in sacks and distributes to her costumers. She is currently out of stock and her warehouse is almost empty. She plans to buy more food items soon.

Abena is married with three children and her husband is a farmer. Abena is responsible for paying some of her family’s expenses, especially the task of providing food for the entire household. She requires this loan so that she can to afford to go to Techiman, a distant town where foodstuffs are cheaper. She will purchase more goods in bulk for resale. Abena hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business and also to use them to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more food items in bulk for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a firewood seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Ndanyela group loan (Group code 2019). Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Adelaida is 40 years old, married, and has five children: ages 23, 20, 18, 16 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for resale, to expand her business

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: mbaye kébé est un chauffeur né le 04 N0VEMBRE 1970 à thiès:il est marié et est père de quatre enfant;il est membre de la mutuelle depuis plus de trois ans et a toujours remboursé ses prets correctement:avec la somme qu'il demande il veut réparer son véhicule qui est en panne et qui est sa principale source de revenu
texts.en:
Mbaye Kébé is a driver who was born on November 4, 1970 in Thiès. He is married and the father of 4 children. He has been a member of the credit union for more than 3 years and has always reimbursed his loans correctly. With the sum that he is requesting, he is going to repair his vehicle which is broken down and is his principal source of revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repairing his vehicle, used as a taxi

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en: Asenati V., 62, is married with nine children.  She has four years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people/public three days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala.  SPBD loans are Asenati’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer and wheel barrow

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama, a 45-year-old divorced mother of a daughter who is a seamstress, has sole responsibility for the child, and business progress rests on her shoulders. Determined to provide for her daughter through hard work and commitment, Ama has been hawking cosmetics including spray, powder, lip gloss, blouses etc., and baby products such as diapers, napkins, etc. for five years now.  She says that selling cosmetics is very lucrative, and she now wants to expand her inventory to increase her income in order to sponsor her child’s education. Ama is confident that your loan support will help her to achieve that goal.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of cosmetics and baby products.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard M. is a young businessman who lives in Oro Vista Subdivision, Concepcion, Marikina City.  He is 27 years old and single.  

Business runs in the family. Leonard’s parents have been in the business of selling RTW (ready-to-wear) apparel for three decades. Leonard started as an errand boy in their store. He saw that the business was good, so when he came of age and had already saved a few thousand pesos, he established his own general merchandise store selling RTW and other dry goods in 2005. Leonard now earns at least P20,000 a month.

He joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in October 2008.  He has finished repaying his previous loan with CCT and is expecting a new loan in the amount of P11,000.  He will use the funds to purchase  more items to sell, including footwear (flip-flops).

Leonard dreams of owning space inside a shopping mall. 


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase footwear to sell at his general merchandise store

loans.name: Dipu

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipu M. is a 37-year-old lady who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur District, Nepal. She lives in a single family with her husband, Mr. Mangal M., and their two sons. Her older son is in grade 10 and her younger son is in primary school.

Mrs. M. and her husband opened their kitchenware shop seven years ago. In their shop they sell different types of steel items, including dinner plates, glasses, jugs, spoons, cups, cooking pots and much more. The income from the shop meets the basic needs of the family. Now they are requesting their third loan of NPR30,000.00 from Kiva to buy more steel goods and expand the shop.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es: Noel Antonio A. M. tiene 46 años, tiene 2 hijos que asisten a una escuela. La actividad económica de Noel es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio con solamente con  muy poco capital y con las ganancias obtenidas fue invirtiendo en la compra de mas productos, además con la ayuda de los financiamientos logro reunir el dinero que le hacía falta. En Fundación León 2000 encontró la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio ya que por medio de Fundación obtiene la ayuda de las organizaciones amigas. Por lo que el dinero lo solicita es para la compra de golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales y jugos. Los sueños de Noel son de seguir mejorando su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar adecuado para vivir.
texts.en:
Noel is a 46-year-old father of two school-age children. For over 3 years he has owned and run a small corner shop. He started it with very little capital and invested his gains in the purchase of even more products. This form of financing has helped him raise the money that he was lacking. With Fundación León 2000 he found the opportunity to grow his business and has also found help from the organization’s friends. The loan he requests is for the purchase of candies, bread, sodas, and juices. Noel’s dreams are to improve his housing so that his children can have a suitable place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Sai P. is married with two school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Battambong Province. To make a living, she is engaged in the agriculture sector, growing vegetables, typically earning US $5 per day. Her husband operates his motor taxi at the nearby markets, earning an income of US $3 per day. Both of them have to work hard every day to ensure a good living for the family, especially the children. Therefore, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US$ 300 to pay taxes for her husband's motorbike.

loans.use: pay taxes for the motorbike

loans.name: Renchin-Osor

texts.en: Renchin-Osor O. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house. Her youngest two daughters currently attend a local secondary school. O. operates a flour and rice selling business out of a shipping container at the local market. She travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, two to four times a month to purchase her products and transports them back to her container to sell. O. started her business in 2003 by first renting the container that she now owns. Over the years she has worked hard to build a stable business operation and has gained much experience. Her business is very important to her and her family. She says, "My only wish is to provide a good education for my children and to help them become good people."
